title: Milwaukee Bucks injury report: What is the latest on Giannis? Live updates
description: The Bucks will try to extend their winning streak to four games when they host the Raptors on Feb. 22 at Fiserv Forum.
fullText:
The Milwaukee Bucks return to Fiserv Forum for the first time since Feb. 6 when they host the Toronto Raptors in a matinee this afternoon. The game is the start of a four-game homestand through Feb. 27, and a stretch of nine home games through March 10.

The Bucks (24-30) will try to win a fourth straight game for the first time this season.

They have won six of their last seven games and three in a row, which has matched their previous season-long win streak. Milwaukee remains completely out of the postseason picture, however, in 11th place in the Eastern Conference.

Toronto is currently the fifth seed in the East with a 33-23 record, including an impressive 17-10 mark on the road.

Tip-off is scheduled for 2:30 p.m. CT.

Bucks superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is getting closer to a return from a Jan. 23 calf strain, though, as he participated in a live practice with coaches and teammates Feb. 21.

More: What does Giannis Antetokounmpo want? He wants to retire with the Milwaukee Bucks

Taurean Prince, out (neck surgery)

Giannis Antetokounmpo, out (right calf strain)

Myles Turner, questionable (right calf strain): Turner has been out since Feb. 12 with the injury.

Guards: Ryan Rollins, Kevin Porter Jr., AJ Green

The game will be broadcast locally on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin with Lisa Byington, Marques Johnson and Melanie Ricks on the call.

Toronto is a 2.5-point favorite over Milwaukee, with the over/under set at 219.5 points per BetMGM.

This article originally appeared on Milwaukee Journal Sentinel: Milwaukee Bucks injury report: What is the latest on Giannis?

title: New UFC Heavyweight Rankings: Spivac Returns to Top 10 After UFC Fight Night Houston Win
description: On Saturday night, the MMA world leader returned to Paramount+ with a new UFC Fight Night card in Houston, TX. [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
On Saturday night, the MMA world leader returned to Paramount+ with a new UFC Fight Night card in Houston, TX. On the event‚Äôs main card, top 15 heavyweights Serghei Spivac and Ante Delija went toe-to-toe, looking to move up in the UFC heavyweight rankings.

Spivac ended up getting the decision win after a violent and back-and-forth war. Let‚Äôs look at how his victory changed our latest UFC heavyweight rankings.

Serghei Spivac has remained a consistent top-15-level fighter at heavyweight for the last five years. While he has lost six times inside the Octagon, his most recent setbacks have come to elite competition like Tom Aspinall, Waldo Cortes-Acosta, and Ciryl Gane. However, he also has quite a few big wins against big-name or ranked foes.

He scored another in February when he earned a very hard-fought win over talented finisher Ante Delija. His latest win stopped a potential losing skid and got him back in our top 10.

Former Brave CF star Shamil Gaziev has put together a notable run in the division. Although a doctor stoppage in 2024 gave him his first loss, the Dagestani big man is 3-1 in the Octagon, including two nasty knockouts. Gaziev is a rising heavyweight fighter to keep an eye on. However, he took a big risk in November when he okay‚Äôd a short-notice fight with Waldo Cortes Acosta. The decision backfired, and he suffered a stinging knockout loss.

PFL and Contender Series veteran Rizvan Kuniev lands in our UFC heavyweight rankings after he scored the biggest win of his career with a hard-fought victory over Jailton Almeida in February. While it wasn‚Äôt pretty, he proved he can compete with top-10 talent. He will need a definitive W in his next fight if he wants to hold on to a spot in our latest rankings.

Marcin Tubura has quietly been a mainstay of the UFC heavyweight rankings over the last half-decade. While he owns a 14-8 record in the company, he has grown immensely as a fighter in the last few years. He is 10-3 in his last 12, with his only losses coming to elite talents Alexander Volkov, Serghei Spivac, and current interim heavyweight king Tom Aspinall.

In March, he picked up a hard-fought win over Aspinall‚Äôs trainer partner and one of the better rising prospects in the division, Mick Parkin.

Sergei Pavlovich has been an absolute crushing machine during much of his UFC career. After a loss to Alistair Overeem in his debut, he reeled off six straight wins, and all of those victories came by way of a devastating knockout. However, a two-fight losing streak stopped all of his momentum. But he has righted the ship in 2025 and scored a pair of decision wins. The most recent was against Waldo Cortes-Acosta in Shanghai.

Dominican big man Waldo Cortes Acosta has quietly become a serious force in the heavyweight division. In his 12 bouts inside the Octagon, he has posted 10 wins, including against some notable talents in the top 15. The latest came in January at UFC 324 against fan-favorite Derrick Lewis.

‚ÄúSalsa Boy‚Äù showed why he is one of the more athletic and polished strikers in the division when he added a two-time challenger to his hit list inside the Octagon.

While there have been some very tough losses in the career of Curtis Blaydes, he has remained a top-five level heavyweight for much of the last decade. At UFC 299, he had an opportunity to finally right his big-fight wrongs and did so in a major way when he handed Jailton Almeida his first loss in the Octagon.

The win moved ‚ÄúRazor‚Äù into a UFC 304 title fight against Tom Aspinall. Unfortunately, his big fight curse returned, and after a strong start suffered a TKO loss in Round 1. At UFC Baku, the talented wrestler returned and was able to grind out a hard-fought win over Rizvan Kuniev. But the victory did little to get him back into title contention.

Alexander Volkov has been a top-level MMA heavyweight for a long time. While he has been unable to earn a UFC title shot, he has remained a stalwart of the top 10 for years. To many who watched UFC 310, he scored a victory against Ciryl Gane that should have earned him a title. However, the judges did not score it his way, and he suffered a crushing defeat to the Frenchman.

In October, he bounced back from the setback to get himself right back into title contention by scoring a very hard-fought split-decision win over top-five talent Jailton Almeida.

Ciryl Gane is a fantastic athlete and the most technical heavyweight striker in the sport. It is why he is consistently in the title discussion. However, his wrestling deficiencies continue to be a problem, and they showed up again in his UFC 310 clash with Alexander Volkov. Fortunately for ‚ÄúBon Gamin,‚Äù he was able to escape with a decision win.

The victory earned him a title opportunity at UFC 321. However, the good luck he had against Volkov turned to bad, and his chance at winning UFC gold again was stopped after just a few minutes when he poked champ Tom Aspinall in both eyes and caused a fight-ending no-contest.

Englishman Tom Aspinall is the best heavyweight in the UFC. That became official when MMA GOAT Jon Jones decided to walk away from the sport earlier this year. The Englishman has beaten many of the best fighters in the division for the last three years and is the undisputed top big man in the eyes of most UFC fans.

After definitively avenging the lone loss of his UFC career in the summer of 2024, he made his first defense of the undisputed title in October. Unfortunately, a nasty eye poke from opponent Ciryl Game ended the UFC 321 main event after just a few minutes. An immediate rematch early in 2026 seems likely.

title: Wolves analysis: Bottom club impressed despite defeat
description: Despite the result, Wolves manager Rob Edwards should be happier with his side's performance as they were the more competitive side before Ladislav Krejci's red card on 61 minutes - and frustrated Crystal Palace after it.  While Palace had marginally more possession in the first half, Wolves spent more time in the home side's final third, with Mateus Mane and Andre providing a spark in midfield.  Yerson Mosquera intercepted a Palace pass in their own half and although he was fouled, referee Thomas Kirk did well to wave play on and moments later Mane was brought down in the box by Adam Wharton.
fullText:
Despite the result, Wolves manager Rob Edwards should be happier with his side's performance as they were the more competitive side before Ladislav Krejci's red card on 61 minutes - and frustrated Crystal Palace after it.

While Palace had marginally more possession in the first half, Wolves spent more time in the home side's final third, with Mateus Mane and Andre providing a spark in midfield.

They had more efforts on goal too, and it felt like a goal was coming when they earned their penalty on 41 minutes.

Yerson Mosquera intercepted a Palace pass in their own half and although he was fouled, referee Thomas Kirk did well to wave play on and moments later Mane was brought down in the box by Adam Wharton.

Tolu Arokodare's side-footed spot-kick was easy for Henderson to save low to his left, though, and was the Nigeria striker's fifth straight penalty miss, a run stretching back to September 2022.

The visitors' five shots on target in the opening 45 minutes are the most they have registered in the first half of a Premier League game since last April.

It was only Krejci's dismissal that forced them onto the defensive for most of the second half, and they actually had the home side hanging on during the nine minutes of stoppage time.

Palace's late winner prevented Wolves reaching 11 points, which would have put them level with Derby's record for the fewest points in a Premier League season, but after avoiding defeat in their previous three games, it is surely just a matter of time before Edwards' side avoid that ignominy.

title: NFL mock draft: 3-round simulation doesn't get Arizona Cardinals a QB
description: The Cardinals get help on the EDGE, at tackle and at cornerback. They miss out on QB Ty Simpson.
fullText:
It is another mock draft weekend. Every weekend until the actual 2026 NFL draft, we will run simulations for the Arizona Cardinals. Because compensatory picks have not been announced yet, exact Day 3 picks are still uncertain, so this mock draft simulation is only three rounds.

In this mock draft, using Pro Football Network's simulator, the idea was to try and make it match with what NFL.com draft analyst Daniel Jeremiah said about the Cardinals. They could be in the mix for an edge rusher, and quarterback Ty Simpson would make sense in the second round.

The Simpson pick didn't happen, though.

Here are the results of the three-round mock draft.

The Cardinals have not drafted a player outside the Big Ten or SEC in the first two rounds of the draft in three drafts under general manager Monti Ossenfort. Bailey can be the exception. OhiO State's Arvell Reese is on the board, and he woudl fit the profile, but Bailey is a standard, true edge rusher, and the Cardinals simply need help there. Josh Sweat had 12 sacks, and no one else made any sort of impact, and Sweat made no impact on any fourth quarter.

Bailey will make Sweat better, and Sweat's presence will be great for Bailey.

We go back to the SEC. The Cardinals need a right tackle, and Proctor is a monster at 6-6, 369 pounds.

He fills that void in a large way.

Why couldn't it be Alabama QB Ty Simpson? He was drafted 15th in this simulation.

Another cornerback? Well, yes, because the Cardinals' corners can't stay healthy. Neal would pair nicely with Will Johnson with both of their size. Johnson is 6-2. So is Neal.

So the Cardinals add defensive help and get a bookend tackle. That's not a bad result.

Get more Cardinals and NFL coverage from Cards Wire's Jess Root and others by listening to the latest on the Rise Up, See Red podcast. Subscribe on Spotify,¬†YouTube¬†or¬†Apple podcasts.

This article originally appeared on Cards Wire: NFL mock draft: 3-round simulation doesn't get Arizona Cardinals a QB

title: Johnny Gaudreau's children join the US Olympic gold medal celebration
description: Johnny Gaudreau's No. 13 jersey was hanging in the U.S. locker room throughout the Olympics, and Dylan Larkin and Matthew Tkachuk carried it around the ice after the U.S.
fullText:
MILAN (AP) ‚Äî Johnny Gaudreau's No. 13 jersey was hanging in the U.S. locker room throughout the Olympics, and Dylan Larkin and Matthew Tkachuk carried it around the ice after the U.S. beat Canada in overtime to win the country's first gold medal at the Games since 1980.

Then, the tribute to the late player known as ‚ÄúJohnny Hockey‚Äù went even further.

The oldest two of Johnny and Meredith Gaudreau's three children were in attendance, along with their grandparents, Guy and Jane, and they got to be part of the celebration. Larkin and Werenski brought 3-year-old Noa and 2-year-old Johnny Jr. on the ice for the team photo, which also had Gaudreau's jersey in it. To a man, players said he should have been with them.

‚ÄúIt meant everything," said Werenski, who assisted on Jack Hughes' golden goal in overtime. "This is something John would have been at. And to see his family here supporting us and seeing his kids, bringing them on the ice, we talked about playing for him, making him proud and I think we did that. Super special to see them and to have kids on the ice, he was a huge part of USA Hockey.‚Äù

Johnny and his brother, Matthew, died in August 2024 when they were struck by an SUV while riding bicycles near their hometown in New Jersey on the eve of their sister Katie‚Äôs wedding.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs with us here in spirit for the whole tournament," captain Auston Matthews said. ‚ÄúTo have his jersey out there in the team photo and have his kids come out and be with us, we‚Äôre obviously thinking of him.‚Äù

An elite player a decade into his NHL career and the all-time U.S. leading scorer in international play, Johnny Gaudreau was on track to be in Milan. Guy Gaudreau said USA Hockey told the family that their oldest son was on the projected roster.

‚ÄúHe obviously would have been on this team ‚Äî and been a huge part of it,‚Äù forward J.T. Miller said. ‚ÄúA guy I grew up with and against and knew pretty well. It‚Äôs more than hockey, at that point. ... He deserved better, and he had a big part in how things went down today.‚Äù

Larkin, who was also clsoe to Gaudreau, dedicated what is just the third U.S. men's hockey gold in history to Gaudreau and former USA Hockey executive Jim Johannson, who died unexpectedly just before the 2018 Olympics.

‚ÄúThis is for the guys who wore this jersey before us,‚Äù Larkin said. "All those people should be here. Johnny especially, Matty his brother. To get it done today, it‚Äôs just an unbelievable feeling.‚Äô‚Äô

AP Winter Olympics: https://apnews.com/hub/milan-cortina-2026-winter-olympics

title: Pereira ‚Äòfrustrated‚Äô but ‚Äòvery confident‚Äô after Nottingham Forest lose late to Liverpool
description: Nottingham Forest manager Vitor Pereira admitted he was ‚Äúangry with football‚Äù after his side conceded a stoppage-time winner against Liverpool, but insisted he remains confident Forest can win the...
fullText:
Nottingham Forest manager Vitor Pereira admitted he was ‚Äúangry with football‚Äù after his side conceded a stoppage-time winner against Liverpool, but insisted he remains confident Forest can win their fight for survival.

A 98th-minute goal from Alexis Mac Allister leaves Forest 17th in the table, just two points above West Ham United, who have lost only one of their last five matches.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm frustrated. Frustrated inside. Angry with football,‚Äù Pereira admitted.

‚ÄúBut, it‚Äôs time to keep the mentality to come back stronger and with confidence to face the future because, you know, the first half we played in the way that we played in Istanbul, but we didn‚Äôt score the goals. We didn‚Äôt score the chance that we created. We created two good chances to score, but we didn‚Äôt.‚Äù

Asked whether there were any positives to take from the performance, the former Wolves manager found it hard to reflect positively.

‚ÄúNo, it‚Äôs very difficult,‚Äù he admitted.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm very frustrated today and it‚Äôs very difficult to go inside the dressing room. What can I say to them?

‚ÄúThey try everything to win the game, even after we conceded the first goal, we had the chance to score firstly, because we had the chance to shoot outside and try, because we want to win the game, we want to win the game.

‚ÄúIn the end it was not one point, it was zero and this is difficult, but this is football. Football is not‚Ä¶ we don‚Äôt have time to complain about the end, we need to, about this game, we need to put our focus on the next game.‚Äù

Forest now turn their attention to the Europa League, where they hold a three-goal advantage ahead of the second leg against Turkish giants Fenerbah√ße.

However, the priority remains the league, with a crucial trip to Brighton next weekend.

Despite his frustration, Pereira insists he believes his squad has enough quality to stay up.

‚ÄúOf course, of course, [I am] very confident, very confident,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm frustrated, but very confident because if we keep this mentality, if we keep this ambition, and the organisation, we‚Äôll get points for sure.‚Äù

title: Dodgers Stars Strike a Pose for Picture Day
description: The Dodgers had media picture day while at spring training in Glendale, Arizona, and stars like Shohei Ohtani, Kik√© Hern√°ndez and Yoshinobu Yamamoto hit their best pose.
fullText:
It‚Äôs almost time for Dodgers baseball, and if you want a preview of what the Boys in Blue will look like on television broadcasts, you‚Äôre in luck.

Los Angeles had media picture day while at spring training in Glendale, Arizona, and stars like Shohei Ohtani, Kik√© Hern√°ndez and Yoshinobu Yamamoto hit their best pose.

Some players, like Teoscar Hernandez, Miguel Rojas and Ohtani, were shown in action, using a slowed-down swing to create the best images.

Others, like Max Muncy and Kik√© Hern√°ndez, used bats more like a prop.

One thing in common most players had, though, was a straight face ‚Äî with one major exception.

Mookie Betts let the camera see his pearly whites.

Coming off back-to-back World Series titles, one would think the Dodgers would be in better moods.

After all, winning an instant classic Game 7 in Toronto to lock up a second-straight championship is no easy feat.

But perhaps they‚Äôre already focused on this year, when they‚Äôre trying to make history as the first time to three-peat in nearly three decades.

Not since the New York Yankees of 1998 to 2000 has a team won back-to-back-to-back World Series.

With championships already in 2020, 2024 and 2025, this team is already a dynasty, but adding another ring in 2026 would truly set these Dodgers apart, making them perhaps one of the best teams in baseball history.

Success can be a double-edged sword, and for the Dodgers, it‚Äôs only made bigger the targets on their backs.

San Francisco Giants CEO Larry Baer¬†recently called the club the ‚Äúdragon to slay‚Äù in baseball, and New York Mets owner Steve Cohen said he won‚Äôt be intimidated by the Dodgers‚Äô big-spending ways.

‚ÄúThey have the ability to spend. So do I, by the way,‚Äù Cohen said, as quoted by Anthony DiComo, Mets beat writer for MLB.com.

What do you think? Will the Dodgers run it back again?

title: Incredible Eberechi Eze stat as midfielder scores in North London derby
description: Eberechi Eze just loves playing in the North London Derby. Having been at the centre of a transfer tug-of-war between Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur last summer, Eze has haunted Spurs since opting for ...
fullText:
Eberechi Eze just loves playing in the North London Derby. Having been at the centre of a transfer tug-of-war between Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur last summer, Eze has haunted Spurs since opting for their arch-rivals.

Eze became the first player in Premier League history to score a hat-trick in the first North London Derby of the season, scoring three times as Arsenal thrashed Tottenham 4-1 at the Emirates.

Recalled to the starting side for the reverse fixture at Spurs this afternoon, he opened the scoring at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium for his fourth North London Derby goal of the campaign.

Incredibly, Eze‚Äôs goal was his first shot on target in the Premier League since netting his hat-trick goal in that win over Spurs on November 23rd.

However, the 27-year-old‚Äôs joy was short-lived as Spurs struck back just 24 seconds after the restart. Randal Kolo Muani capitalised on Declan Rice‚Äôs error to equalise for Spurs and level proceedings.

title: Honoring Javonte Williams three-year, $24 million deal with his top 24 plays with the Cowboys
description: Javonte Williams had a great season for the Cowboys in 2025.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have ensured their backfield remains locked and loaded by re-signing breakout running back Javonte Williams to a new¬†three-year, $24 million contract. The agreement, which includes¬†$16 million in guaranteed money, comes after weeks of front-office speculation regarding the impending free agent. By locking up Williams before the start of the new league year, the Cowboys avoid having to get caught up in a bidding war for the 25-year-old running back had he entered the open market.

Last week, we mentioned the Cowboys should re-sign Williams to keep their rushing attack on point. Williams earned a total of $4 million with incentives last season, and we indicated that his new asking price would double. Right on cue, that‚Äôs exactly where his new contract fell.

Williams earned every penny of his new¬†$8 million annual salary¬†during a career-defining 2025 campaign. After joining the Cowboys on a cheap prove-it deal, he shattered expectations by recording career-highs across the board, finishing with 1,201 rushing yards,¬†11 rushing touchdowns, and an efficient¬†4.8 yards per carry. His physical style provided the perfect thunder to the Cowboys‚Äô high-flying passing attack, as he ranked among the league‚Äôs best with¬†3.58 yards after contact per carry¬†and helped Dallas finish with the¬†NFL‚Äôs ninth-best rushing offense.

The idea of retaining Williams had been heavily debated. The team has gotten by using cheap running back resources over the past two seasons, first with Rico Dowdle in 2024, and then with Williams last year. There‚Äôs a school of thought that the Cowboys could once again try to mitigate their running game cost with a low-cost replacement.

However, the front office thought better of it and opted to keep Williams. While paying a chunk of money for a running back may not be ideal, the Cowboys feel good that they have their guy. He checks off a lot of boxes for what head coach Brian Schottenheimer and offensive coordinator Klayton Adams look for, and he has already demonstrated he fits well in the offense.

Williams is a physical runner, turning short gains into big plays through sheer contact balance. He shows exceptional vision and patience to navigate through the proper running lanes. His agility and impressive jump-cut ability make defenders miss and create new paths for longer runs. He has a nose for the end zone, which was evident by his numerous short-yardage and goal-line successes. He‚Äôs a reliable asset in pass protection who‚Äôs always willing to throw his body into a would-be blitzer. And his resiliency last year proved that his once-concerning knee injury appears to be a thing of the past.

With Williams locked down, the Cowboys will enter the new year with a rare sense of stability at the running back position. The team can now shift its financial focus to other high-priority stars like¬†wide receiver George Pickens. And while the Cowboys will have to shell out some cash to hang on to these gamble acquisitions from a year ago, at least they can feel good about shoring up their offensive weapons for the remaining peak years of Dak Prescott‚Äôs career.

To honor Javonte Williams' new three-year, $24 million deal with the Cowboys, here are his Top 24 plays of the 2025 season. pic.twitter.com/LRuUdarzPy

‚Äî Dan Rogers (@DannyPhantom24) February 21, 2026

title: Manchester United vs. Everton preview, kick-off time, how to watch, and team news
description: Manchester United travel to Everton in the final fixture of Premier League matchweek 27, with both sides chasing European qualification as the season enters a decisive phase. The contest carries added intrigue with rivals having already played, meaning the stakes will be clear by the time kick-off arrives.
fullText:
Manchester United travel to Everton in the final fixture of Premier League matchweek 27, with both sides chasing European qualification as the season enters a decisive phase.

The contest carries added intrigue with rivals having already played, meaning the stakes will be clear by the time kick-off arrives.

Here is everything you need to know ahead of Monday night‚Äôs clash.

Everton host United at the Hill Dickinson Stadium on Monday, February 23, 2026, with kick-off scheduled for 8 pm GMT.

Michael Carrick‚Äôs appointment as head coach until the end of the season has sparked a notable upturn in form at Old Trafford. United have collected four wins and a draw under his guidance, reviving hopes of a top-four finish and a return to the Champions League.

Everton remain in the mix for a Conference League berth and could close the gap on United with a victory. However, they are searching for their first home league win since December, a run that has stalled momentum in the race for a top-six position.

In the United Kingdom, the match will be broadcast live on Sky Sports Main Event and Sky Sports Premier League from 6:30 pm GMT. Subscribers can also stream via the Sky Go app.

David Moyes has most of his squad available for the reunion with his former club. Jack Grealish, currently on loan, is sidelined following surgery and is not expected back this season. Jake O‚ÄôBrien is suspended after his recent dismissal.

For United, Mason Mount is set to return to the matchday squad after recovering from a minor knock. Matthijs de Ligt remains unavailable with a back issue, while Patrick Dorgu is sidelined with a hamstring injury and is not expected to return until April.

Both teams enter the game well rested after early FA Cup exits earlier this month. Everton‚Äôs recent home struggles contrast with United‚Äôs improving momentum under Carrick.

These are fixtures United must navigate successfully to maintain control of their Champions League ambitions. Expect the visitors to edge the contest.

Prediction: Manchester United to win 3-1.

title: Why Red Sox‚Äô Alex Cora likes about Trevor Story batting second in lineup
description: Alex Cora‚Äôs Red Sox lineup against the Blue Jays on Sunday could be very similar to what his Opening Day lineup looks like on May 26 in Cincinnati.
fullText:
FORT MYERS, Fla. ‚Äî Alex Cora‚Äôs Red Sox lineup against the Blue Jays on Sunday could be very similar to what his Opening Day lineup looks like on May 26 in Cincinnati.

‚ÄúJust trying to win this league (Grapefruit League) so I just felt that‚Äôs a good way to set it up,‚Äù manager Alex Cora joked at JetBlue Park on Sunday. ‚ÄúBut yeah, it‚Äôs something I envision. And it just happened that for the first time in years what you see early is what you‚Äôre probably going to see on Opening Day.‚Äù

That means Trevor Story is a strong candidate to open the season in the second spot, following leadoff hitter Roman Anthony.

Story started in the No. 2 hole in his final 10 games of the 2025 regular season. He also batted there in all three of Boston‚Äôs AL Wild Card Series games against the Yankees.

Analytics show that a team‚Äôs best hitter should bat second. Story batted .294 with a .339 on-base percentage, .497 slugging percentage and .836 OPS over his final 84 games last season. Still, for the full the season, he posted a .308 on-base percentage, tied for 111th among qualified major league hitters. His .333 slugging percentage ranked 72nd among qualified major leaguers.

What does Cora like about Story in that spot?

‚ÄúWhat he did last year, the last three months, he was one of the best hitters in the big leagues,‚Äù Cora said. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs not about earning or he deserves whatever. But the guy stole 30 bags, he drove in 90-something runs, hit 20-something homers. He was amazing hitting the ball the other way. And if that‚Äôs the case, he‚Äôs going to be surrounded by lefties, which at one point, they‚Äôre probably going to bring a lefty for Roman. He‚Äôll face a lefty and he can cash in.‚Äù

Story likes the idea of batting second.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs kind of where I‚Äôve hit most of my career is two,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúLast year was kind of four or five. So either way. I‚Äôm comfortable really in those spots, two, three, four, five. And I think Roman setting the table is going to be huge. And then with JD protecting me, I like that.‚Äù

Story thinks the Red Sox are ‚Äúa team that can win in different ways.‚Äù

‚ÄúAn offense that can create with speed, stretch singles into doubles, put the ball in the gap, hit home runs, too,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúObviously, Willson helps us a lot with that. He hits the ball super hard. Just been one of the most consistent, good hitters since I‚Äôve been in the big league. So pumped to add that to the mix.‚Äù

Red Sox lineup: Trade addition starting at third base, Trevor Story batting second

Red Sox pitcher who‚Äôs reached 104 mph discovered baseball at 16 thanks to the Red Sox

Some Things I Think I Think: Roman Anthony is already the ‚ÄòFace of the Red Sox‚Äô

Red Sox get first taste of drastic rule change: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs here ‚Äî¬†and we have to adjust,‚Äô Alex Cora says

Red Sox‚Äô Payton Tolle gets a fresh start, from the beginning

title: Jack Draper shares the ‚Äòvery weird‚Äô tradition he has before every match
description: Jack Draper is set for his first ATP match since the US Open at the Dubai Tennis Championships. The British star has been out of action for six months with an arm injury, but he recently returned at the Davis Cup.
fullText:
Jack Draper is set for his first ATP match since the US Open at the Dubai Tennis Championships.

The British star has been out of action for six months with an arm injury, but he recently returned at the Davis Cup.

A worrying Rotterdam Open withdrawal followed the Davis Cup, but Draper has now signed up for his return in Dubai.

Ahead of just his second match in six months, Draper shared a strange tradition he has before his matches.

It would be easy to assume that tennis players listen to upbeat music ahead of their matches, but that‚Äôs not what Draper does.

Asked what he does before his matches, Draper responded: ‚ÄúProbably listening to birds on Spotify. It‚Äôs pretty weird.‚Äù

However, the British number one defended his decision and suggested it relaxes him before high-octane action on the court.

He added: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a nice one. You should try it, it‚Äôs very therapeutic. Just not listening to music the whole time. Just get on some nice birds. It‚Äôs nice. It‚Äôs very weird.‚Äù

Draper proved himself to be one of the finest up-and-coming stars in tennis after his performances in 2025.

The British star won his maiden Masters title and earned himself an impressive career ranking high of world number four.

The draw has been made for the Dubai Tennis Championships and Draper has been given a kind opening to his second competitive match back.

Draper will play qualifier Quentin Halys in the first round, a player he has yet to lose to in their two matches.

Should Draper find a way past the Frenchman, he will await the winner of Fabian Maroszan or Arthur Rinderknech.

The British number one has been drawn in the same section of the draw as Stefanos Tsitsipas, Alexander Bublik, and Andrey Rublev.

Despite missing six months of action, Draper is the fourth-best-ranked player at the ATP 500 tournament.

title: President Donald Trump helps UFC contender with immigration woes
description: Uros Medic had an important phone call with Donald Trump
fullText:
Uros Medic may have cleared one major hurdle in his quest to headline a UFC event in his home country.

UFC Houston proved to be a banner show for Medic, who scored a nasty first-round knockout of Geoff Neal in Saturday‚Äôs co-main event. Afterwards, Medic called for a fight with former welterweight champion Leon Edwards and for it to take place in Medic‚Äôs native Serbia.

However, Medic admitted immigration issues have prevented him from leaving the United States and implored President Donald Trump to help clear up the situation.

‚ÄúI got one little problem,‚Äù Medic said. ‚ÄúImmigration‚Äôs been holding me up and I can‚Äôt travel just yet. So this is my plea for help. Mr. President, if you can see this, please, we‚Äôve got to go to Belgrade, Serbia, for the UFC this summer.‚Äù

According to Medic, his plea did not fall on deaf ears, as UFC CEO Dana White later invited him to his office to speak to Trump personally. Trump assured Medic that his immigration issues will be taken care of.

‚ÄúAs an immigrant it‚Äôs a little hard getting things done,‚Äù Medic said. ‚ÄúI know how busy they are, almost everyone in the world wants to live in the United States so immigration, it is hard. They have a lot of work to do and my case has been kind of backed up and not moving, so I was just waiting and waiting and waiting and at one point, I mean, I probably could have mentioned before I‚Äôve been five years in the UFC, five years there was no changes. I have work permit, I‚Äôm allowed to work, there was travel documents for me to travel. I never felt safe using them because there was COVID and all this bullshit. So I never used them and I didn‚Äôt travel, so at this point I was already at the end of my patience and I had to say something and I think it was a perfect opportunity to speak my mind about it. Again, not wanting to knock them down or talk anything bad about them, I know they‚Äôre all trying to do their jobs, but I have to use the position that I‚Äôm at and I had to mention it because it‚Äôs been hard not being able to travel home.

‚ÄúLittle did I know I get back, a phone call with Dana White, I‚Äôm back in his office, and Dana‚Äôs got President Donald Trump on speakerphone and I was just standing there, I cannot believe what‚Äôs happening. He said, ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre good to go wherever you please. Just give Dana the documentation information that you need‚Äô and I‚Äôm just blown away.‚Äù

It‚Äôs unclear how much more bureaucracy Medic actually has to deal with so that he can return home and potentially help White arrange a UFC event in Serbia‚Äôs capital, but he was heartened by his conversation with the president, whose wife Melania hails from nearby Slovenia.

‚ÄúIt was just amazing for me to tell him about the situation and how big of a fan I am of him and obviously his wife was from where I‚Äôm from,‚Äù Medic said. ‚ÄúConsidering where I‚Äôm from, even though it‚Äôs a different country, it‚Äôs like a five-hour drive, that‚Äôs nothing for America. You can‚Äôt even get out of Texas in five hours.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still processing all of it. Dana just made my dreams come true for the second time. Third time. First, was to get signed; second, was to go into the top 15; now, I just got to speak with Mr. President on the phone and he said I‚Äôm good to travel. My stuff is done, so it‚Äôs going to take a minute for me to just process this. A lot has happened in the past hour.‚Äù

title: Serie A rivals aiming to overtake Juventus in the race for Bournemouth defender
description: Juventus aren‚Äôt the only Serie A club that is trying to acquire the services of Bournemouth centre-back Marcos Senesi, as Roma have reportedly entered the fray.The Bianconeri will be looking to stre...
fullText:
Juventus aren‚Äôt the only Serie A club that is trying to acquire the services of Bournemouth centre-back Marcos Senesi, as Roma have reportedly entered the fray.

The Bianconeri will be looking to strengthen their backline next summer with one or more additions, and the Argentine appears to be at the very top of Marco Ottolini‚Äôs shortlist.

The 28-year-old is supposedly at the peak of his powers and has already garnered experience in the most competitive domestic league in the world, having joined the Premier League side in the summer of 2022.

Moreover, Senesi‚Äôs contract with the Cherries will expire at the end of the season, so he‚Äôll be available on a free transfer.

The defender‚Äôs out-of-contract status has attracted several top suitors between England and Europe, including Manchester United. Nevertheless, many sources have identified Juventus as the club that made the most concrete approach thus far.

And yet, the Old Lady could end up missing out on the player‚Äôs services, as Roma believe they can usurp them in the race.

Marcos Senesi (Photo by Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

According to Il Corriere dello Sport (via TuttoJuve), the Giallorossi feel they would have the advantage over their Turin-based rivals if they managed to pip them in the Champions League race.

Qualifying for Europe‚Äôs elite club competition would give the Romans a major financial boost and increase their appeal.

Juventus appeared to be on the right track to book their place in the Champions League after a mid-season revival under Luciano Spalletti.

However, the team lost its way in February and is currently on a skid after losing four of their last five matches across all competitions.

Their latest defeat to Como didn‚Äôt only serve as a blow to their Top-Four hopes, but also invited the Lariani back in the race.

Interestingly, Roma and Juventus will cross paths next weekend in a direct showdown for a Champions League spot, but the Giallorossi are currently ahead in the table.

Therefore, the Bianconeri must find their winning form immediately, as failing to qualify for the Champions League will certainly impede their chances of recruiting their top summer targets.

title: The ‚Äòuncomfortable‚Äô conversations England need to have after thrashing by Ireland
description: George Ford took responsibility for twice missing touch as England suffered a second damaging defeat in a row
fullText:
George Ford has said that England must have some ‚Äúuncomfortable‚Äù conversations after their Six Nations title hopes were all but ended by a record defeat to Ireland.

The visitors secured their biggest win at Twickenham in a 42-21 thrashing that raised huge questions over an England side that had started their campaign by beating Wales to extend a 12-match winning run.

Two below-par showings have followed, though, with England comfortably second best against Ireland having been beaten in Scotland last week to leave head coach Steve Borthwick mulling changes in personnel and approach.

Vastly experienced fly half Ford endured another difficult day, twice missing touch with punted penalties to the corner as he squandered field position in another profligate performance from the hosts.

The Six Nations fallow week perhaps comes at a good time for a reeling England and Ford admits that the team must be ‚Äúhonest‚Äù about where they are at before preparing for meetings with Italy and France in the competition‚Äôs final fortnight.

‚ÄúYou've got two options. You either beat around the bush a little bit and avoid things or you get to be properly honest and pick it to pieces,‚Äù Ford emphasised.

‚ÄúWe're going to be part of some uncomfortable meetings and some uncomfortable reviews, which will be a positive in the end because we actually want to address things and get to the root of some of the problems and come up with some solutions.

‚ÄúWhen you have a couple of results like this, you‚Äôve got to front it up, take it head on and make sure that we actually properly get to some proper solutions where we can grow from it.‚Äù

Ford admitted that his two failures to find touch were ‚Äúnot acceptable‚Äù, though suggested he felt the second of them had actually stayed the right side of the corner flag.

The 32-year-old playmaker was one of three centurions in Steve Borthwick‚Äôs squad with captain Maro Itoje winning his 100th cap, but that experience failed to show as England failed to heed the lessons from the Scotland defeat with a disastrous start again proving costly.

‚ÄúWe've got to get to the bottom of it,‚Äù Ford said. ‚ÄúIt's clearly not good enough, and clearly in the first 15-20 minutes in a Test match you want to at least give yourselves a foothold in the game.

‚ÄúWe were far too inaccurate. I think in the game we gave 24 turnovers away in a variety of ways. From some kicking stuff, some breakdown, some set-piece. I think Ireland were pretty ruthless and clinical when they had opportunities in the first 15, 20 minutes.

‚ÄúWe didn't stem that quick enough, it got away from us a little bit when it went to 22-0. We give ourselves a mountain to climb so a couple of things there: first of all we need to be better in the first place, in terms of not giving the opposition that many turnover opportunities, and it doesn't allow us to build pressure. And secondly if we do concede, how can we stem it quicker? We can't really let it get to 17-0 or 22-0, we can't let it do that, and we've done that twice in two weeks now.‚Äù

Ford could come under pressure for his place from Northampton‚Äôs Fin Smith when England face Italy in Rome on Saturday 7 March.

title: Nebraska softball shuts down No. 11 Texas A&M in 8-2 victory
description: Nebraska faced No. 11 Texas A&M in the second day of the Mary Nutter Collegiate Classic on Saturday night. The Huskers shut down the Aggies, 8-2.
fullText:
Nebraska softball (9-4) faced No. 11 Texas A&M (9-5) in the second day of the Mary Nutter Collegiate Classic on Saturday night. The Huskers shut down the Aggies, 8-2, grabbing their fifth top-15 win of the season.

Jordy Frahm (3-3) and Alexis Jensen delivered the one-two punch on the day in the circle, combining for 14 strikeouts against seven hits, four walks and two runs. Nebraska's defense held Texas A&M to its second-lowest scoring game of the season. The Aggies average over seven runs a game.

Frahm got the win for the Huskers, pitching 5.0 innings and striking out 10 batters, her second double-digit strikeout game of the season. She allowed only five hits and one run. Jensen pitched the final 2.0 innings,¬†firing four strikeouts and allowing two hits and one run.

Nebraska totaled eight hits for eight RBIs on the night. Frahm delivered in the batter's box, hitting 2-for-3 with one walk for four RBIs. She struck a three-run home run in the sixth, putting the game away for the Huskers. Jesse Farrell¬†hit Nebraska's first home run of the game in the fifth, a solo shot.

Ava Kuszak, Carlie Muhlbach¬†and¬†Kacie Hoffmann¬†all added a hit and an RBI, helping Nebraska dominate the weekend on offense. In just three games, the Huskers outscored their opponents 30-3, averaging .410 as a team and hit eight doubles, six home runs and 29 RBIs.

Nebraska concludes the classic on Sunday against Seattle and California. The Huskers start the day against the Redhawks at 11 a.m. CT before facing the Golden Bears on 1:30 p.m. CT. Both games will be streamed on FloSoftball.

Contact/Follow us¬†@CornhuskersWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Nebraska news, notes and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Cornhuskers Wire: Nebraska softball shuts down No. 11 Texas A&M in 8-2 victory

title: Steve Borthwick mulls changes after England defeat to Ireland ‚Äî and explains Maro Itoje decision
description: England head coach Steve Borthwick has admitted that he will have to consider changes after a record defeat to Ireland at Twickenham ‚Äì though defended Maro Itoje‚Äôs fitness despite again taking his captain off early.  The hosts were outclassed in a 42-21 defeat at the Allianz Stadium that all but ended their already fading title hopes as England suffered a second defeat on the spin.  The manner of the loss was striking, too, following up a similarly sloppy showing in Scotland to raise some tough questions for a side that had entered this Six Nations on a run of 11 consecutive victories.
fullText:
England head coach Steve Borthwick has admitted that he will have to consider changes after a record defeat to Ireland at Twickenham ‚Äì though defended Maro Itoje‚Äôs fitness despite again taking his captain off early.

The hosts were outclassed in a 42-21 defeat at the Allianz Stadium that all but ended their already fading title hopes as England suffered a second defeat on the spin.

The manner of the loss was striking, too, following up a similarly sloppy showing in Scotland to raise some tough questions for a side that had entered this Six Nations on a run of 11 consecutive victories.

England were again let down by a horror start that saw Ireland seize a 22-0 advantage. Borthwick went to his bench early, bringing on hooker Jamie George for Luke Cowan-Dickie before the half-hour mark and introducing Marcus Smith at full-back just prior to the half-time interval.

Itoje, meanwhile, played just 54 minutes of his 100th cap before being replaced by Alex Coles. The lock is usually an 80-minute man for Borthwick but had endured a disrupted build-up to the Six Nations campaign due to both injury and the death of his mother.

‚ÄúI think Maro is in very good condition,‚Äù Itoje‚Äôs head coach stressed. ‚ÄúI think his sharpness will continue to develop. Ultimately, if you look from the end of the autumn to now, he only was able to play a couple of games due to an injury, but I think he will get fitter and fitter over this next period.‚Äù

Borthwick, who also saw scrum half Alex Mitchell go off early with a soft tissue injury, also conceded that he may have to consider changes in personnel and strategy after back-to-back defeats.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been really clear on objectives for improvement,‚Äù Borthwick said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll look very closely at that over the next two days, so that we reconvene with the players that we ensure we‚Äôre specific about what we improve.

‚ÄúThe team‚Äôs been very good at games that have been tight, even if we‚Äôve gone one or two scores down and then been excellent in the second half and always come through to find a way to win. Unfortunately, for two games running now, we‚Äôve given the opposition too much of a head start, giving ourselves a mountain to climb. We certainly need to address that.

‚ÄúMy job over the next couple of days is to be really clear about that. Look at how I‚Äôve set the team up over the last 18 months that‚Äôs led to consistently high-level performance and results, and look at that for the last couple of games, and then decide on what needs to change. I‚Äôll look at the medical status of all the players and then understand what we need to do going forward.‚Äù

After the fallow week, England take on Italy in Rome before finishing their campaign against Six Nations favourites France in Paris. They will head to Verona to train between those two fixtures, rather than returning home.

One of Marcus Smith and George Furbank, who is back to full fitness, could come under consideration at full-back ahead of Freddie Steward, while Borthwick may also mull giving Fin Smith a start at fly half.

Jack van Poortvliet and Ben Spencer are the options within the squad to replace Mitchell if the scrum half is ruled out, and Chandler Cunningham-South‚Äôs physicality could see the versatile Harlequins forward make his first appearance of the campaign.

title: PFF grades Eric Winters as SEC's top run defender
description: Pro Football Focus grades the Auburn safety as the SEC's top run defender ahead of the 2026 season.
fullText:
For most of the 2025 college football season, the Auburn defense carried the team while the offense struggled. One of the many bright spots on that side of the ball was freshman safety Eric Winters. He was really good against the run, and Pro Football Focus graded him as the top run defender in the SEC at 92.

As a true freshman, Winters recorded 33 total tackles and picked up one sack during the 2025 season. His lone sack of the season occurred against the Texas A&M Aggies in a 16-10 loss. His best tackling game of the season was against South Alabama, with five total tackles in the 31-15 win. Winters showed his potential in the 2025 season opener on the road at Baylor with three tackles. He will factor into the 2026 Auburn defense and should see more time on the field as a potential starter.

Winters was a four-star prospect coming out of high school when he signed with the 2025 class. He played high school football at Enterprise High School in a very tough 7A-Region 2. Some coaches have tabbed the region as the SEC of 7A football in Alabama, with teams like Auburn High, Central Phenix City, Opelika, and Dothan High. During his senior season in 2024, Winters had 60 tackles and three tackles for loss. He also played on offense and scored five rushing touchdowns.

Winters will not just be one of the top defensive players for the Auburn Tigers, but also one of the best in the SEC. One of the many young players Auburn fans should be very excited about.

Contact/Follow us @TheAuburnWire on¬† X (Twitter), and like our page on Facebook to follow ongoing coverage of Auburn news, notes, and opinions. You can also follow Phillip on Twitter @PJordanSports
