title: England's 'Jack of all trades' delivers for Brook again
description: Will Jacks, labeled England's 'Jack of all trades' by Harry Brook, delivers again at the T20 World Cup to keep the winter of a lifetime rolling on.
fullText:
Will Jacks has already had quite the winter.

He made his Ashes debut in Australia, got engaged to his partner Ana in Sydney and now, at times single-handedly, is taking England towards the T20 World Cup semi-finals.

Which would he rank as his best moment?

"That is not for me to answer," laughed his captain Harry Brook.

"But he has had three man-of-the-match awards this World Cup and I don't think he has played his best cricket yet."

Brook and Jacks go back a long way.

They were 15-year-olds when they played against each other at the famous Bunbury Festival ‚Äì Jacks playing for the London schools' side and Brook the north of England.

Jacks made 46. Brook took two wickets.

Four years later they were roommates with the Under-19s and now Jacks is keeping Brook's first World Cup campaign as captain afloat.

When this tournament began with questions around Brook's suitability to be captain after off-field controversy in Wellington, it was Jacks who was put forward to speak to the media to defend his mate.

Against Nepal, the right-hander hit 39 not out, without which England would have suffered one of the great World Cup shocks, and his first T20 fifty against Italy, a powerful 53 not out, pushed a tight game out of the reach of the Italians in their valiant chase.

His 21 with the bat and three wickets with the ball against Sri Lanka was another gift for Brook, coming on the captain's 27th birthday.

England now sit one win from a World Cup semi-final.

"He is a very competitive lad," said Brook. "He was annoyed when he got out tonight.

"After his first over he said 'I always bowl better when I am annoyed'. That was one of the reasons I kept him on.

"He is that perfect player. He is the Jack of all trades who can do everything."

Jacks' Ashes was not all fairytale proposals below Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Off the field, he was one of the England players plastered across the front page of the Australian newspapers with a pint in hand in Noosa.

On it, he struggled with his two wickets in the third Test against Australia in Adelaide costing 212 runs. Across the series he took six wickets for 394 runs.

Jacks' stubborn batting in Australia did show a side of his game that hinted at promise and now he is thriving as England's T20 man for all seasons.

Backed by Brook on Sunday he was asked to open the bowling for England for the first time since a match against Australia in Barbados at the last T20 World Cup.

That day, after what Jos Buttler later described as a "gut feel", Aussie opener Travis Head ‚Äì the man who cut and pulled him into submission in Adelaide ‚Äì sent him onto the Kensington Oval roof in an over that cost 22 runs. England's campaign never recovered.

This time his opening over cost only four, even that a boundary courtesy of a misfield.

Brook said it was a "last-minute" decision to give Jacks the new ball, the logic being that with a shorter boundary to the left-handed Kamil Mishara's leg side it was better to have Jacks' off-spin turning the ball away.

Typically, after that good first over, Jacks dismissed two right-handers in his next ‚Äì the dangerous Kusal Mendis poking and chipping back a catch and Pavan Rathnayake charging and slicing a catch high to the off-side ring.

"Rathnayake's been a very good player for them, and probably their best player of spin - the way that he runs down the pitch," Brook said.

"To get him out first ball was a very crucial part in the game for us."

Control was something often lacking with Jacks' off-spin during the winter but here he delivered his most accurate spell.

Bowling four overs on the spin, he pitched 91% of his deliveries on the stumps or in the channel - the highest of any England match of his career.

His only bad ball, one which slipped from his sweaty hand, was pulled for six by Dasun Shanaka but later Jacks got his revenge by being the initial catcher in a brilliant relay grab with Tom Banton.

If his first three wickets put England on course for victory, the dismissal of Shanaka confirmed it.

"I love getting the responsibility with the ball," Jacks said.

"It encourages me to get into the game and perform better.

"[Opening the bowling] is not foreign for me. And with a surface like that, I come in knowing what to do."

Jacks has been given the nickname of Slim Shady by some England players during this tournament ‚Äì a reference to his pre-tournament haircut and bleached blond hair. In the dressing room he has even been asked to rap.

Brook appears happy with his Jack of all trades. He is keeping this winter rolling on.

title: France maintain Grand Slam dream with Italy win
description: France record a bonus-point win against a spirited Italy in Lille to maintain their bid for a Six Nations Grand Slam and back-to-back titles.
fullText:
Tries: Bielle-Biarrey, Meafou, Ramos, Drean, Gailleton Cons: Ramos 4

France recorded a bonus-point win against a spirited Italy in Lille to maintain their bid for a Six Nations Grand Slam and back-to-back titles.

Les Bleus raced into a 19-0 lead through tries by Louis Bielle-Biarrey, Emmanuel Meafou and Thomas Ramos, who was a late switch at fly-half after Matthieu Jalibert was ruled out of the game.

Despite the early dominance on the scoreboard, Italy remained competitive and responded by an Ange Capuozzo try and a Paolo Garbisi penalty.

With Louis Lynagh in the sin-bin, debutant Gael Drean grabbed the vital bonus-point try and Emilien Gailleton crossed in a less eventful second half.

The visitors have only beaten France twice in the Six Nations, with the 2024 game ending in a thrilling draw in Lille.

France, who lost only one game in last year's championship, next travel to Edinburgh to face Scotland on Saturday, 7 March, while Italy host England on the same day.

Given Galthie's side's strength at home, where they will play England in the final game, the next match could define their Grand Slam hopes.

"I think we always believed we would get the bonus-point win," Meafou told ITV.

"We knew Italy were a strong team, they hung in for 80 minutes, they never cracked and they never let go.

"Our goal is to take out the Six Nations game by game but the end goal is the 2027 World Cup so we keep working towards that."

Back-to-back heavy defeats for Steve Borthwick's side will also help build Italy's confidence of recording a first win over England.

Gonzalo Quesada's side defeated Scotland in the opening round and ran out of steam to compete in the second half against Les Bleus.

France's slick attacking play blew away Ireland and Wales in the opening two rounds to emphatically begin their pursuit of a first Grand Slam since 2022.

Flash tries had the visitors on the back foot early as Antoine Dupont's kick through found flyer Bielle-Biarrey for him to score in a record eighth successive Six Nations game.

Following Meafou's finish from close range, Gailleton's clean break came out of nothing to help set-up Ramos' try.

Two years ago in Lille, the hosts learnt the hard way to not overlook an improving Italy side as Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post to deny them a first Six Nations victory in France.

Italy, who pushed Ireland close in Dublin last week, stayed calm in the chaos and should have had one more than one first-half try that was scored by Capuozzo.

Despite fading in the second half, Quesada's side's scrum - like in Dublin - was a real weapon in the game to win penalties.

Centres Tommaso Menoncello and Leonardo Marin both looked threatening and could cause England's defence, which has been struggling, problems.

"The scoreboard is always the truth of the game and we have to go with that," Italy captain Michele Lamaro told ITV.

"France were unbelievably good at taking their opportunities, especially in the first half.

"We couldn't build pressure in the second half and that took us to 70 minutes when we got the yellow card."

The hosts had to work hard for the important fourth try but were never in danger of a shock defeat.

Anything other than a Grand Slam now would feel like a failure for what is a great French side.

France: Attissogbe; Drean, Gailleton, Brau-Boirie, Bielle-Biarrey; Ramos, Dupont (capt); Gros, Marchand, Aldegheri, Flament, Meafou, Cros, Jegou, Jelonch.

Replacements: Mauvaka, Neti, Colombe, Ollivon, Guillard, Nouchi, Serin, Barassi.

Italy: Fischetti; Lynagh, Menoncello, Marin; Ioane; P Garbisi, Fusco; Fischetti, Nicotera, Ferrari, N Cannone, Zambonin, Lamaro (capt), Zuliani, L Cannone.

Replacements: Dimcheff, Spagnolo, Zilocchi, Ruzza, Favretto, Odiase, Garbisi, Odogwu.

Assistant Referees: Luke Pearce (Eng) and Eoghan Cross (Ire)

title: Why 2026 marks a Winter Olympic turning point for Team GB
description: Three golds, a record-equalling medal haul - the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics has been one to remember for Team GB.
fullText:
If someone had told you 16 days ago that Team GB would win three gold medals at the Winter Olympics, would you have believed it?

Tonight, flagbearers Matt Weston and Charlotte Bankes will lead Team GB into the closing ceremony in Verona as the curtains are drawn on a historic Games for the nation.

In winning five medals, GB has equalled its record best from both 2014 and 2018.

But it has been the nation's most successful Winter Olympics since the moment snowboarders Bankes and Huw Nightingale won the second of those golds in the mixed team snowboard cross.

Never before had Great Britain won more than one gold medal at a Winter Olympics. That fact has now been buried deep in the snow.

Weston kick-started the golden rush, withstanding the heavy pressure on his shoulders to win the men's skeleton title that was always his to lose.

On what has come to be known as 'Super Sunday', Bankes and Nightingale won Team GB's first Olympic gold medal on snow, a victory that was followed just a few hours later by Weston and Tabby Stoecker's mixed team success at the Cortina Sliding Centre.

On the penultimate night of competition, the men's curling team - skipped by Bruce Mouat - won their second successive Olympic silver, before freestyle skier Zoe Atkin wrapped up Team GB's Games the next day with bronze in the halfpipe.

"These Games have been amazing, and a history-making Games," Team GB chef de mission Eve Muirhead told BBC Sport.

"This Games has really proven that we are capable, that we have so much potential, and we're growing. We're a growing winter nation, which is really exciting.

"With the French Alps [Winter Olympics] in four years time, this is a catalyst to those Games."

Weird and wonderful stories from the Winter Olympics

But for all the medals, there were all the near-misses.

In total, there were five fourth-place finishes, some of which were by the most narrow of margins.

Take freestyle skier Kirsty Muir, for example. Just 0.41 of a point was the difference between bronze and fourth place in the slopestyle.

Had she not squatted on a landing on her final run, she would have made the podium.

Agonisingly, she then recorded another fourth in the big air.

Snowboarder Mia Brookes, meanwhile, knew she needed to go huge on her final big air run for a chance of a medal - and so she did.

She landed a competition-first backside 1620 trick - featuring four-and-a-half rotations - but over-rotated at the very last moment.

Had she landed it cleanly, she would have won a medal.

"Fourths make champions," GB Snowsport chief executive Vicky Gosling told BBC Sport.

"We are fourth in the world. Kirsty's from Aberdeen, she started on the dry slopes. Mia started on the dry slopes in Manchester and then look where they've got to. We should be utterly proud of what we've achieved here."

Around the Games, there were plenty of other performances that may not have brought home a medal, but were record-breaking in their own right.

In cross-country skiing, Andrew Musgrave and James Clugnet recorded a fifth-place finish in the team sprint event, the nation's best Olympic result in the sport.

That bettered Musgrave's sixth in the 10km interval start freestyle, while Anna Pryce recorded a best British women's result at an Olympics with her 32nd place in the sprint classic.

Stoecker, Freya Tarbit and Amelia Coltman all finished in the top 10 of the women's skeleton, while there were more than 20 top-10 finishes in total.

"I think because of the depth and breadth across so many sports and disciplines, it shows that we are not a one-trick pony," said UK Sport's director of performance Kate Baker.

"We're mixing it with the very best in winter sport. I think we can be really excited about what we've achieved."

Team GB will fly home on Monday, after which the post-Games reviews will begin, by both the British Olympic Association and the individual sports themselves.

Over the four-year cycle leading into the Milan-Cortina Games, UK Sport ploughed ¬£25.5m into winter sports on the Olympic programme, up from ¬£22.2m for the Beijing 2022 cycle.

The funding for the next cycle, leading up to the 2030 Games, will be confirmed and announced in the summer, though the individual sports have already received a provisional figure for planning purposes.

But while an important metric, funding isn't just based on the number of medals won, or a reward for it. UK Sport also looks at future potential, as well as the impact and resonance on the watching British public.

Baker told BBC Sport Team GB's athletes had gone "above and beyond" in delivering value for money, and asked how that success is now built on, she said: "The reality is we've been thinking about it for the past four years. Already the work is in place to build for that next Games and indeed the one after.

"We've got some real talent coming through, there is no shortage of British talent, and we know we can show that we can mix it with the best on the world stage when it matters.

"The next four years is about supporting that talent that's coming through and also making sure that we do everything we can so that when they get here on finals day, they are absolutely at their best."

UK Sport's investment is not an ever-growing pot, however, and sports are being encouraged to work together and share resources where possible to build towards the greater good.

Gosling, whose GB Snowsport organisation received ¬£7.3m in UK Sport funding for its 2026 Olympic programme but has had to bring in extra commercial revenue, said: "We know we have the talent and the capability and the world has now seen it.

"We can deliver medals with what we have. We have demonstrated that, but we have greater potential than we're demonstrating right now."

She added: "This is just the start. This is not the peak for us. There's so much more that we can achieve. And I'm super excited because the athletes that are competing and are just near missing, are those athletes that are still very young with a great future ahead of them.

"And guess what? 2030 is just on the doorstep and we'll be back and we'll be showing them. Let's hope we'll convert those near misses to golds. The world's our oyster."

title: USA win men's Olympic ice hockey gold for first time in 46 years
description: United States win the men's Olympic ice hockey gold medal for the first time in 46 years by beating neighbours Canada in overtime.
fullText:
The United States won the men's Olympic ice hockey gold medal for the first time in 46 years by beating neighbours Canada 2-1 in a sensational conclusion to the 2026 Winter Olympics.

The final gold medal of the Games was sealed by Jack Hughes in overtime after the USA withstood pressure from the dominant Canadians throughout most of the match, goalkeeper Connor Hellebuyck having the game of his life.

It is the first time since the 'Miracle on Ice' at Lake Placid in 1980 that the USA's men have won Olympic gold.

And it is the first time the Americans have won the competition outside of their home country.

This was the second ice hockey final between USA and Canada at Milan-Cortina 2026, after the American women triumphed in their gold medal match - also 2-1 in overtime.

Now, the men have completed a remarkable double triumph.

After a tight start, USA broke through in brilliant style through some individual magic by Matt Boldy.

Boldy picked up the puck inside his own half, chipped it over two defenders and outmuscled them to collect it before nudging it around a stranded Jordan Binnington.

Canada, as they had in the previous two knockout rounds, needed to come from behind but struggled to build momentum until towards the end of the second period.

The USA defended manfully, including a period when they were three against five with two in the penalty box.

But in the 38th minute, a quick switch from Devon Toews found Cale Makar wide open on the right and he drove the puck past Hellebuyck.

Canada continued to dominate in the third period, and in regular time had 41 shots to USA's 26.

But they seemed to find every possible way not to score. Hellebuyck kept out Mitch Marner from close range with a stunning piece of goalkeeping, before Nathan MacKinnon somehow swept wide of an open goal at the back post.

And the Americans came close to re-taking the lead themselves at the end of the second period when Brock Faber's slap shot deflected off the post.

It meant three-on-three overtime for the first time in Olympic history. In the gold medal match, both teams field three players plus a goalkeeper in overtime, and play until a goal is scored with no shootout.

And after both sides had chances, 101 seconds into overtime Hughes buried his shot to write his name into American sporting folklore.

Day-by-day guide to the Winter Olympics

Full schedule including times of medal events

Winter Olympics 2026 medal table

This game had an extra edge, thanks in part to the presence of NHL players at the Olympics for the first time since 2014.

There was also the political angle. When these sides met in February 2025, it came in the shadow of USA president Donald Trump threatening tariffs on Canada and referring to their northern neighbours as the 51st state.

Trump was not present in Milan, and neither was Canadian prime minister Mark Carney who was pictured watching the final in Quebec.

After the game, the official White House account on X tweeted, external a picture of a bald eagle - a national animal of the USA - attacking a Canada goose, responding to a post from former Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau.

In last year's match, there were three fights in the first nine seconds. While the players kept their cool here with much more on the line, there was still plenty of heat from the crowd.

The supporters at Santagiulia were partisan in favour of the Canadians, with the USA team roundly booed before face-off.

However Canada were given a major blow pre-match with the absence of talismanic captain Sidney Crosby.

The 38-year-old, a veteran of the Olympic triumphs in 2010 and 2014, was forced off in their last-eight win over Czech Republic with a knee injury. Crosby missed the Finland semi-final and Canada's coaches hoped to have him available today - but he was not in the squad.

And his leadership was missed as Canada dominated large parts of the game but lacked coolness under pressure to convert their myriad of chances.

The USA instead claimed their country's 12th gold of these Games, finishing second in the medal table. Canada end a disappointing 11th.

After the game, USA players carried the jersey of former team mate Johnny Gaudreau who was killed by a drunk driver in August 2024.

Watch Bo Nix‚Äôs impressive highlights from 2025 season
description: Bo Nix had a brilliant season in 2025. Relive his best moments!
fullText:
It's fair to say Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix has set a high bar moving forward after a fantastic 2025 season. Nix was a huge part of the reason for the Broncos' success on offense, creating plays with his arm and his legs.

Nix created many highlight-level plays and late-game magic through several games in 2025. The best example of Nix's clutch gene came in a midseason matchup against the New York Giants. After having not scored at all through 45 minutes of play, Nix rallied the Broncos back from a 19-0 deficit in the final quarter, and led one of the most epic comebacks in franchise history, securing a 33-32 win. Nix had several games this season where he did his best Tim Tebow impression.

Through the season, Nix made history again and again, both team history and NFL history.

One of his most memorable performances during the year was his divisional round masterpiece against the Buffalo Bills, leading Denver to its first postseason win in a decade. In the win, Nix went 26-of-46 for 279 yards, three passing touchdowns and one interception. Nix showed the moment is not too big, and stepped up to the plate in a big way. Sadly, Nix's season ended shortly after the game, with a broken ankle.

You can watch some of Nix's greatest hits from his second season below.

The bar has been set, and as Nix recovers from the ankle surgery that ended his 2025 season, he'll look to return even better in 2026.

title: 'This isn't a miracle': Mike Eruzione shares heartfelt thoughts on Team USA in gold medal game
description: This is a much different story.
fullText:
'This isn't a miracle': Mike Eruzione shares heartfelt thoughts on Team USA in gold medal game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

There will never be a moment in the history of United States sports quite like Mike Eruzione's goal.

Yes, the goal, the one that toppled the Soviet Union in the 1980 Winter Olympics in Lake Placid, the one that led to Al Michaels' broadcast call, "Do you believe in miracles? Yes!"

And so there's no one quite equipped to talk about the 2026 U.S. Olympic men's hockey team than Eruzione.

He wanted to make one thing clear, though, in a hype video posted Sunday by USA hockey:

"This isn't a miracle," he said.

"It's time," Eruzione said. "This is the best hockey team we've ever put on the ice... They're talented. They're gifted. They're skilled. They're young."

MORE:¬†Eileen Gu responds to hate only way she knows how

He shared that it's something his teammates want for the current players.

"My teammates and I want this moment, we want these guys to achieve something," Eruzione said.

And then he shared a heartfelt thought about his grandchildren.

"What we did is what we did, it's over, it's ended, it's 40 something years ago," Eruzione said. "My grandkids need their hockey heroes. And it's gonna be this team. I believe it. I firmly believe this is the best team in the tournament."

Eruzione goes on to reference that some of the players on this year's team have referenced the movie Miracle as inspiration on the journey to this point.

Now, he wants them to write their own story.

title: Is Tage Thompson playing today in the gold medal game? Team USA forward injury news is released
description: The United States doesn't have a whole lot of questions.
fullText:
Is Tage Thompson playing today in the gold medal game? Team USA forward injury news is released originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Team USA doesn't have as big an injury question mark as Canada does for the gold medal game with Sidney Crosby.

The United States will be wondering whether Tage Thompson is good to go, though, after leaving the semifinal after the second period and not returning.

The gold medal game is at 2 p.m. local time in Italy on Sunday, less than 48 hours after the U.S. completed their semifinal blowout of Slovakia.

Thompson had a goal and an assist in that game.

They'd certainly like the 6-foot-6 forward from the Buffalo Sabres to be good to go for the final.

MORE:¬†Nathan MacKinnon went viral for his Olympic focus that paid off

UPDATE:¬†Tage Thompson is officially ACTIVE for Team USA for the gold medal game.

The expectation was that yes, Thompson will play in the gold medal game.

He was at Saturday's practice, and head coach Mike Sullivan told reporters that Thompson looked sharp.

The reasoning for his absence from the third period on Friday had been "precautionary" anyway, and that appears to be accurate.

MORE:¬†Megan Keller's childhood dreams culminate in a dream come true

With a gold medal on the line, Thompson isn't expected to miss the opportunity.

Thompson is on a bottom-six even-strength line for the U.S., but on the powerplay, he jumps up to the first unit.

That's where he scored his low-angle slapshot goal on Friday, and it's where he's hoping to be again on Sunday.

title: Tyrann Mathieu suggests Patriots learn from Chiefs' Super Bowl LV loss
description: Tyrann Mathieu suggests the New England Patriots learn from the Kansas City Chiefs' Super Bowl LV loss | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
The Kansas City Chiefs' loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Super Bowl LV forced an offseason change to improve the offensive line's protection of Patrick Mahomes. The adjustment was witnessed firsthand by former safety Tyrann Mathieu, who believes the same standards should apply to the New England Patriots.

The three-time Pro Bowler spoke about the situation during a recent episode of his podcast 'In the Bayou with Tyrann Mathieu'.

"New England should take sort of the Kansas City Chiefs approach. After we lost [Super Bowl LV]‚Ä¶ the very next day, they got new offensive linemen," said Mathieu, "You gotta be able to protect the product."

Tyrann Mathieu‚Äôs thoughts on the #Patriots Super Bowl loss:

‚ÄúNew England should take sort of the Kansas City Chiefs approach. After we lost [the Super Bowl]‚Ä¶ the very next day, they got new offensive linemen‚Ä¶ You gotta be able to protect the product.‚Äù

(üé• @InTheBayouPod) pic.twitter.com/W8bIB1kAJE

‚Äî Carlos A. Lopez (@LosTalksPats) February 16, 2026

Mathieu's comments echo those of many who watched the Seattle Seahawks defense dominate the Patriots' offensive line in Super Bowl LX. Left tackle Will Campbell was the target of much of the criticism, although he had an impressive season.

The Chiefs notably signed Orlando Brown Jr., Joe Thuney, and Kyle Long after Super Bowl LV to vastly improve their offensive line for the following season. New England is expected to focus on Drake Maye's protection during the offseason after he was sacked an NFL record 21 times during the 2025 postseason.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Tyrann Mathieu suggests Patriots learn from Chiefs' Super Bowl LV loss

title: NFL 2026 trade scenarios, Part 1: Who deals for Maxx Crosby?!
description: Let's run through some possible trade scenarios.
fullText:
As the 2026 NFL offseason nears, it's worth looking at some possible trade scenarios for some of the league's top players. Who might get dealt around March's kickoff to the new NFL year?

In a first of three parts, we've imagined some possible NFL trades featuring some of the biggest names in the league. Don't worry; we hit the ground running with some real blockbusters involving elite talent.

We'll have 10 more trade ideas coming your way in the time to come, but it'll be good to get started off on the right foot. Who might wind up elsewhere? What would the trade packages look like? Inquire within!

Will Crosby actually be dealt? Your guess is as good as mine, but Mike Vrabel has to be banging the tables to bring in the ace pass-rusher. The Patriots defense having that kind of edge rusher to wreak havoc would go such a long way to complement the tight secondary coverage. While Crosby can't protect Drake Maye's blindside, he'd make the quarterback's life easier by adding more balance to the other side of the ball. If the Patriots can improve their pass-rush with Crosby, they'll be better than they were in 2025. It'd be a slam-dunk to bolster a Super Bowl contender into a new league altogether on defense. In return, the Raiders could get a nice package of picks and a solid addition to the edge room in Anfernee Jennings to at least take a little of the bite out of trading away Crosby.

TRADE PACKAGE: Crosby to New England for a 2026 first-round pick, a 2027 second-round pick and Jennings

The Titans desperately need to get quarterback Cam Ward a field-stretching wide receiver to take his game to the next level. Tennessee, flushed with cap space, could make Moore an integral part of the Titans' passing game without sending away too much draft compensation. With wide receiver Calvin Ridley a very possible cut candidate, the Titans could really use a veteran in the room like Moore. Ward being able to air it out a bit more would be huge for his development; Moore could also use a fresh start after getting a decrease in targets with Ben Johnson. Let's say the Titans send a third-round pick back to Chicago to get this done; that feels reasonable for both sides.

TRADE PACKAGE: Moore to Tennessee for a 2026 third-round pick

The Vikings desperately need to undo the Sam Darnold decision. Watching Darnold win a Super Bowl with Seattle has to burn like the heat of a thousand suns for Minnesota fans who watched J.J. McCarthy struggle in his first full year as a starter. McCarthy's future already feels in flux as a Viking, and Minnesota's contention window may not support his clear need for more development. Enter Mac Jones. The 49ers can sleep easy with Jones as their backup to Brock Purdy, but could Minnesota pry Jones away by throwing McCarthy into the trade package? Perhaps Kyle Shanahan would be intrigued by the idea of developing McCarthy behind Purdy as a more long-term insurance plan. Jones proved in 2025 that he could be a decent starter in the right system. Swapping out Shanahan for Kevin O'Connell could keep the positive streak going for the former Patriots first-round pick. McCarthy could step back into the shadows to develop under Shanahan's watch, and Jones could start for a playoff-ready roster. Win-win?

TRADE PACKAGE: Jones to Minnesota for McCarthy, a 2026 sixth-round pick and a 2027 conditional third-round pick

Brown's time with Philadelphia feels tenuous at best. The incredibly talented wideout helped bring a Super Bowl to the City of Brotherly Love, but an uneven 2025 campaign leans toward both sides needing a clean break. Eagles general manager Howie Roseman won't trade Brown for nothing, but we think it's very possible he's sent elsewhere. Where would he go? How about Las Vegas? Presumed Raiders rookie quarterback Fernando Mendoza will need a strong infrastructure to grow with, and Brown could instantly solve the team's wide receiver woes. A trio of Brown, tight end Brock Bowers and running back Ashton Jeanty could skyrocket Mendoza's development and give new coach Klint Kubiak plenty to work with in his first year as a head coach. Let's say a package of draft picks and a potential Dallas Goedert replacement convinces Roseman to trade Brown before the league year gets going.

TRADE PACKAGE: Brown and a 2027 seventh-round pick to Las Vegas for a 2026 second-round pick, a 2027 fifth-round pick and tight end Michael Mayer

Thomas still has sky-high potential in the NFL, even if his future with the Jacksonville Jaguars is in flux. He's only TK and has so much football ahead of him. If he hits with the right team, the payoff could be enormous for both sides... and Thomas is still on a rookie deal. Jacksonville could probably get a really nice return on Thomas, too. Where might he go? How about the Commanders? Washington desperately needs more pop in the passing game to keep quarterback Jayden Daniels from scrambling too much. The team's soaring 2024 crashed and burned in 2025, so a rebound will be vital for all parties to keep their seats from getting hot. Thomas could replace Deebo Samuel as wide out Terry McLaurin's running mate and give Washington a potentially lethal deep threat for Daniels. Jacksonville could get a good draft pick and a young wideout from Washington in return and send Thomas to the NFC.

TRADE PACKAGE: Thomas to Washington for a conditional 2027 second-round pick and WR Jaylin Lane

This article originally appeared on For The Win: NFL 2026 trade scenarios, Part 1: Who deals for Maxx Crosby?!

title: Breaking down the Steelers' picks in mock after trade back
description: In this new mock draft, the Steleers trade back out of the first round to stockpile picks for next year.
fullText:
For the Pittsburgh Steelers, the 2026 NFL draft was supposed to be the draft that fixed their quarterback problems. The team has 12 picks and going into the season, this quarterback class was supposed to be generational in talent.

Once the season got going, the quarterback class was exposed and when the dust settled on the college football season, only one quarterback emerged as a legit first-round draft pick. This means the Steelers are more likely to trade back in the first round and even out of it as opposed to staying put. This would allow the Steelers to build picks for next year's draft in hopes the quarterback class is better.

So let's break down the trades and the picks in this new mock draft update.

Steelers send the No. 21 overall pick and the No. 238 overall pick to the Baltimore Ravens. The Ravens send Pittsburgh the No. 45 overall pick, the No, 80 overall pick along with a second-round pick and a third-round pick in 2027.

The more we watch Bernard and his versatility, the more we like his fit with the Steelers to pair up with DK Metcalf. He lines up all over the field, has a high football IQ and reminds us a lot of Deebo Samuel.

Hood stepped into the No. 1 role for Tennessee last season and showed a very high ceiling as a cover corner. His frame is a little light but he makes up for it with

Golday is a big, powerful inside linebacker who plays with great acceleration and exceptional instincts. If the Steelers release Patrick Queen, this pick is a bargain.

Smart, athletic free safety with a nose for the football and a high football IQ and lots of leadership intangibles.

Whether it's Connor Heyward or Jonnu Smith, we add Bentley here as a Swiss Army knife tight end who is an underrated blocker and receiver.

Washington is an impressive blend of power and speed and he put on quite a show at the Senior Bowl. With Kenneth Gainwell likely to leave in free agency, Washington is the perfect pick.

Excellent developmental guard prospect with solid experience and measurables.

This article originally appeared on Steelers Wire: Breaking down the Steelers' picks in mock after trade back

title: Why is Pat Riley getting a Lakers statue? History, legacy of LA legend
description: The Los Angeles Lakers will celebrate Pat Riley with a statue outside Crypto.com Arena on Sunday, Feb. 22. Here's the latest.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Lakers will celebrate Pat Riley with an unveiling of a statue outside Crypto.com Arena on Sunday, Feb. 22.

The team will hold a private ceremony before the Lakers‚Äô tip-off against the rival Boston Celtics on Sunday afternoon.

Riley played an integral role in helping the Lakers‚Äô organization achieve on-court success and a strong brand identity during the 1980s.

It will be the 15th statue outside of Crypto.com Arena, joining a list of other notable figures from LA Sports history, including Kobe Bryant, Magic Johnson and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

Riley has spent 58 years in the NBA, serving as a player, coach, and executive.

He‚Äôs won an NBA championship in each of those roles, including as a player (1972), assistant coach (198), and a coach (1982, 1985, 1987-88). He also led the Miami Heat to a championship as a head coach in 2006 and as an executive in 2012 and 2013.

Riley not only helped bring championships to the respective organizations but also instilled a unique culture.

Riley became the perfect fit for the Lakers during the 1980s, which is referred to as the "Showtime Lakers" era because it blended the perfect combination of Hollywood flair and on-court showmanship using a roster that included Johnson, Abdul-Jabbar and James Worthy.

Riley matched that flair with his own signature slicked-back hair and Armani suits. The legend‚Äôs success and signature look have carried on in the decades that followed.

He currently serves as the Miami Heat‚Äôs president, a role he‚Äôs had since 1995 and applied what he‚Äôs learned during his time with the Lakers.

Riley drafted Dwyane Wade and acquired Shaquille O'Neal before winning his first title away from the Lakers in 2006. He would resign as head coach in 2008, but would remain in his role as president. As an executive, he helped build a super team, having Chris Bosh and LeBron James join Wade to win back-to-back titles for Miami.

Riley is among the all-time winningest coaches in NBA history, compiling a record of 1,210-694 (.636%). He was enshrined in the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame in 2008.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Lakers to honor Pat Riley with statue outside of arena

title: Vote! Who should be Active Chiropractic boys Athlete of the Week?
description: This week's nominees are from Churchill, Creswell, Sheldon, South Eugene and Thurston.
fullText:
The winter postseason is heating up, and athletes throughout the Eugene-Springfield area have continued to deliver standout performances.

Every week, you get to vote for The Register-Guard's Athlete of the Week, sponsored by Active Chiropractic.

Here are the nominees for this week's boys Athlete of the Week:

Madison Bradshaw, Churchill basketball

Elijah Gabriel, South Eugene basketball

Geno Marzano, Sheldon basketball

Dylan Myrick, South Eugene swimming

Burke Sherman, South Eugene swimming

Churchill junior Madison Bradshaw scored a team-high 15 points Feb. 20 to help the Lancers to a 51-43 road win over Class 5A No. 10 Crater.

South Eugene junior guard Elijah Gabriel scored a team-high 26 points and grabbed eight rebounds Feb. 20 to lead the Axe to a 67-57 home win over Roseburg.

Myrick won the 200 freestyle in 1 minute, 43.21 seconds, won the 500 freestyle in 4:52.7 and also swam legs on two winning relay teams.

Sherman won the 200 individual medley in 1:55.85, won the 100 breaststroke in 58.57 and also swam legs on two first-place relays.

South Eugene senior Tim Trojan tied for a team-high 40 points to help the Axe win the team title Feb. 14 at the Southwest Conference championships.

Trojan won the 50-yard freestyle in 21.85 seconds, won the 100 butterfly in 50.60 and swam legs on two first-place relay teams.

Creswell junior forward Emerson Velarde scored a team-high 16 points and went 4 of 5 from 3-point range Feb. 18 to help the Bulldogs to a league playoff win over visiting Elmira.

Marist Catholic junior Charlie Westover scored a team-high 33 points to help the Spartans to the team title Feb. 21 at the Class 4A/3A/2A/1A Special District 4 championships.

Westover won the 100 freestyle in 52.39 and placed second in the 200 freestyle (1:55.77).

title: Deion Sanders spices up Colorado's spring practices with new concept
description: Deion Sanders introduces a spring draft for Colorado football, splitting the Buffs into teams with hopes of boosting competition and leadership.
fullText:
Deion Sanders does not get to play a spring game against another program, but he found another way to add intrigue to the program's annual showcase.

The Colorado Buffaloes held a spring football draft last week, during which the program's leaders split up to select teams. One team, led by cornerback RJ Johnson, tight ends Brady Kopetz and Zach Atkins, surprised the room by selecting true freshman quarterback Kaneal Sweetwyne with the top pick instead of quarterback Julain Lewis. Safety Ben Finneseth, linebacker Bo LaPenna and running back DeKalon Taylor lead the second team, with them selecting Lewis with the No. 2 overall pick.

Johnson's team also selected running back Richard Young, wide receiver Kam Perry and freshman four-star linebacker Carson Crawford. Standout players on Finneseth's squad include wide receiver Danny Scudero, linebacker Gideon Lampron and running back Damian Henderson II.

Interesting...True freshman QB Kaneal Sweetwyne was picked No. 1 overall in Colorado's spring ball draft. JuJu Lewis went No. 2 pic.twitter.com/SqLblI6KXU

‚Äî LockedOnBuffs (@LockedOnBuffs) February 21, 2026

Sanders spoke to the program after the selection process, explaining the new spring ball outlook.

"Some days, we're not gonna change jerseys. Some days, we're gonna have an all-team day," Sanders told the squad. "You're going to go out there in the color of your team. That's how we're gonna get down. From the jump, it's gonna be like that. It's gonna be this side over here, this color, that's how we stretch. The whole day is gonna be competitive, and we're gonna go at it. From 1-on-1 to inside run, we're keeping score, we're keeping count of everything."

Clearly, Sanders is changing his philosophy following a 3-9 2025 season that saw his program severely lack player leadership. Spring camp is really the only time a college football program can go fully into culture-building mode without the stress of preparing for games. The team's first approach is refreshing to see for a CU program that seemed to miss accountability a year ago.

The two drafted teams will get the first chance to go at each other on March 2, the first day of spring practice. A few weeks later, on April 11, Colorado will play its¬†annual spring game,¬†where both teams will partake in a glorified scrimmage at Folsom Field.

Spring camp is an exciting time for Deion Sanders' Buffs with so many new faces and plenty of position battles to be won.

Follow Charlie Strella¬†on¬†X,¬†Threads¬†and¬†Instagram.

Contact/Follow us¬†@BuffaloesWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Colorado¬†news, notes and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Buffaloes Wire: Deion Sanders unveils Colorado football spring draft

title: Eli Manning offers blunt take on New York Giants QB Jaxson Dart
description: Eli Manning offered a very honest and blunt take on New York Giants QB Jaxson Dart, his playing style, and his future.
fullText:
New York Giants legend Eli Manning delivered a candid and optimistic assessment of quarterback Jaxson Dart's future during a recent appearance on ESPN New York with Dave Rothenberg and Rick DiPietro.

As the franchise transitions into a new era under head coach John Harbaugh, Manning expressed strong confidence in the direction of the team, particularly with Dart positioned as the long-term signal-caller.

When asked about the excitement surrounding the Giants' fresh start, Manning responded affirmatively.

"No, I mean, I think you should be excited. I think the John Harbaugh hire," Manning said, "you could not have asked for a better situation getting him... He‚Äôs the coach we needed, but usually, you know the coach that‚Äôs unavailable, and so I think there‚Äôs a lot of excitement there. You (have) Jaxson Dart... you have your quarterback of the future."

Manning went on to praise Dart's intangibles, highlighting his leadership qualities.

"Well, I just think he‚Äôs a great leader. I‚Äôve seen that in the locker room, just how people talk about him. And obviously he has earned his teammates' respect through his preparation, through his play, and, you know, I think through his toughness," he said.

The two-time Super Bowl champion also offered pointed advice on the next phase of Dart's development, addressing the challenge many young, mobile quarterbacks face in balancing their athleticism with smarter decision-making.

"That‚Äôs kind of like the, you know, the next step for young quarterbacks is, hey, I have the ability to run, but I don‚Äôt want to do that too often. You know, I want to get the ball to the receivers," Manning said, "it‚Äôs just kind of finding that sweet spot of, you know, when you know, hey, I need to get the ball out."

Manning's comments underscore a blend of endorsement and realism: Dart possesses the tools and presence to succeed, but refining his timing, progressions, and willingness to avoid unnecessary risks will be crucial to unlocking his full potential as the Giants' franchise quarterback.

Fans, long weary of quarterback instability, have reason for guarded optimism in this pairing of elite coaching and emerging talent.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Eli Manning offers blunt take on New York Giants QB Jaxson Dart

title: Is Sidney Crosby playing today in the gold medal game? Canada all asking same injury question
description: This could determine everything.
fullText:
Is Sidney Crosby playing today in the gold medal game? Canada all asking same injury question originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

It's the question everyone in Canada is asking.

Will Sidney Crosby play in the Olympics gold medal game? The captain missed the semifinal, and the final is on Sunday against Team USA.

Crosby is the oldest player on Canada's roster and left the quarterfinal with a lower-body injury.

He's a third-line center and a member of the first powerplay unit, when healthy.

It doesn't seem like he'll be at his full health for the gold medal game. But can he play? You'd sure think Crosby wants to.

MORE:¬†Nathan MacKinnon went viral for his Olympic focus that paid off

Crosby has officially been ruled OUT of the gold medal game.

It only came out an hour before opening faceoff, and it's a brutal outcome for Canada.

Crosby had been given a chance to play by head coach Jon Cooper, but Cooper wouldn't give anything major to lean on in his comments Saturday.

TSN's Ryan Rishaug reported Saturday that it's a 70% chance that Crosby suits up and plays. Turns out, it didn't happen.

MORE:¬†Megan Keller's childhood dreams culminate in a dream come true

Canada would've love to have Crosby out there, but it's tricky.

If he dressed but then turned out not to be healthy enough to keep playing, Canada would've been one player light in its rotation.

In not playing, though, that's a major leader and an Olympic legend who they can't lean on on the ice.

Crosby was said to be impacting conversations in the locker room during intermissions in the semifinal, so maybe he can at least do that again.

Most fans in North America only learned the Crosby news once they woke up to their early alarm. For Canada, it was a rough thing to find out.

title: Daronte Jones's history with David Blough before Commanders
description: The Washington Commanders have two new coordinators but they have some familiarity with each other.
fullText:
The Washington Commanders made some big changes to the coaching staff this offseason.

Offensive coordinator Kliff Kingsbury and defensive coordinator Joe Whitt Jr. were both let go, and David Blough and Daronte Jones were brought in, respectively. Neither Blough nor Jones has ever been a coordinator at the NFL level, but they do have some familiarity with each other.

Jones was with the Vikings on the defensive coaching staff from 2022 to 2025. In 2022, Blough was a practice squad quarterback for the Vikings. Recently, Washington insider JP Finlay spoke with Jones about this connection with Blough.

He was really sharp, smart," said Jones of Blough. "He ran the show. It was as smooth an operation as you could have because of his knowledge of the game."

New #Commanders OC David Blough was a practice squad QB with the Vikings in 2022 when new DC Daronte Jones was the DBs coach there

Jones talks with @JPFinlayNBCS about Blough from their time together in Minnesota

"He was really sharp... he ran the show"#RaiseHail pic.twitter.com/5Lz8fynGmS

‚Äî NBC4 Sports (@NBC4Sports) February 11, 2026

Blough has rapidly moved up in the ranks since retiring from playing. The former quarterback was on the practice squad of the Detroit Lions in 2023 and joined Dan Quinn's staff in Washington in 2024 as the assistant quarterbacks coach.

Tavita Pritchard, who was the quarterbacks coach for the Commanders, took the head coaching job at Stanford, his alma mater. That, coupled with Kingsbury's departure, moved Blough up in the pecking order, and now he'll get his first shot at running an offense.

Jones, meanwhile, was the defensive coordinator for the LSU Tigers in 2021 before joining the staff of the Vikings. Jones is a Maryland native, so his first shot at being a coordinator will also be a homecoming.

"You never know how your paths may cross," Jones explained. "You keep those relationships alive, and we had a great relationship when we were there. And now, years later, here we are."

The Commanders are certainly hoping for better results across the board in 2026. The team made a surprising run to the NFC Championship Game in 2024, but thanks to injuries and inconsistency, fell to 5-12 in 2025.

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Daronte Jones on David Blough: 'Really sharp'

title: Bournemouth‚Äôs Marcos Senesi heads summer transfer list for Juventus
description: Bournemouth defender Marcos Senesi has emerged as a priority signing for Juventus this summer.¬†According to a report by La Gazzetta dello Sport, Juventus are in the market for a centre-back and Bourn...
fullText:
Bournemouth defender Marcos Senesi has emerged as a priority signing for Juventus this summer.

According to a report by La Gazzetta dello Sport, Juventus are in the market for a centre-back and Bournemouth‚Äôs Senesi has been identified as a potential target.

The Argentine defender‚Äôs contract with the Premier League outfit expires in June and the Bianconeri will aim to swoop in to get a free transfer done in time before the competition increases.

Juventus management have already prepared an offer for a 3-4 year contract with a salary of ‚Ç¨4-5 million and the inclusion of performance-tied bonuses. The Italian side are not obliged to contact the club since less than six months are remaining on Senesi‚Äôs contract.

Juventus are aiming to do an overhaul in defence after finding Gleison Bremer to be ineffective during the Galatasaray match and Daniele Rugani‚Äôs loan deal at Fiorentina. Federico Gatti is being targeted by several Premier League clubs, and it will be tough to hold on to him soon.

title: How to replace Trey Hendrickson
description: There isn‚Äôt another Trey Hendrickson out there and if there was, we couldn‚Äôt afford him. So now what?
fullText:
The writing is on the wall that this was Trey Hendrickson‚Äôs last year in Cincinnati. So what now?

The Bengals pass rush has been an issue over the last few seasons, even with Hendrickson putting up 17.5 sacks in 2023 and 2024. Now they have to replace him, but can they?

The answer is no. To paraphrase the movie Moneyball. There isn‚Äôt another Trey Hendrickson out there, and if there was, we couldn‚Äôt afford him. But just like in Moneyball, maybe we can build him.

The Super Bowl Champion Seattle Seahawks had an incredible defense, but they didn‚Äôt have anyone with double-digit sacks.

Their leading sack artist was a three-way tie between Leonard Williams, Byron Murphy, and Uchenna Nwosu, all of whom had 7. Demarcus Lawrence wasn‚Äôt far behind with 6.

I think 7 sacks is a very reasonable expectation for Myles Murphy next season. So can they find 3 more players to get in that neighborhood?

The obvious answer is Shemar Stewart. Of course, 7 sacks is more than he has had in his college and pro career combined at this point, so that is a large projection. But if he can stay healthy and be there for the entire offseason program, maybe he can get close. Let‚Äôs say 5.

Still, I don‚Äôt want to rely on that. So the Bengals should look to add three players who are capable of hitting that golden number of 7 in free agency and the draft. At least one of whom needs to be on the interior.

For example, maybe you add Arnold Ebiketie and Vonn Miller.

Ebikitie just turned 27. The 2022 second-rounder had 6 sacks as a rotational player for the Falcons last season and is just entering the prime of his career.

Miller is 10 years older, but still productive, with 9 sacks last season. Miller‚Äôs expertise could also benefit his teammates, as the young defensive front could learn a lot from the seasoned vet.

The duo of Ebiketie and Miller will probably cost less than Jaelan Phillips, freeing up money to be spent elsewhere on the defense.

Murphy, Stewart, Ebiketie, and Miller would make for an excellent platoon of edge rushers.

Inside, B.J. Hill and Kris Jenkins are probably good for 3 sacks apiece, but the Bengals need their Larry Ogunjobi to bring a little bit more juice.

John Franklin-Myers is out there but stands to make some serious coin. However, adding a Peter Woods or a Caleb Banks in the draft could do the trick.

So let‚Äôs say you make these moves. Maybe you get 7 sacks from Murphy, 6 each from Ebikitie and Miller, 5 from Stewart, maybe 5 more from Woods/Banks, and 2 or 3 a piece from Hill, Jenkins, and T.J. Slaton. Thanks a predictive unit. It won‚Äôt cost you too much, and the depth means that one injury won‚Äôt hamper your whole defense.

That‚Äôs the best way for the Bengals to get it done in a post-Trey Cincinnati.

title: Liam Rosenior‚Äôs circle accept they misjudged Cole Palmer at Chelsea
description: Liam Rosenior and those around him have acknowledged that early concerns about Cole Palmer and his Chelsea teammates were unfounded. When Rosenior first took over as the Blues‚Äô manager, there was plenty of scepticism.
fullText:
Liam Rosenior and those around him have acknowledged that early concerns about Cole Palmer and his Chelsea teammates were unfounded.

When Rosenior first took over as the Blues‚Äô manager, there was plenty of scepticism. Many fans saw it as a cheap and uninspired choice following Enzo Maresca‚Äôs exit.

Rosenior has done well to change that narrative. He has won eight games, drawn two, and lost two ‚Äì both defeats coming against Arsenal in the Carabao Cup.

One of the standout aspects has been how he has handled big names like Palmer. There are plenty of social media clips showing his relaxed approach, and behind the scenes, his man-management skills have been evident in how he‚Äôs communicated with players privately.

The Standard reported that those around Rosenior had concerns early on about whether Palmer and the other big names in the squad would get behind his methods.

They feared a lack of respect could become a problem.

But as results have improved, Rosenior has seen that the dressing room is more together than he expected. He also feels that each win is helping to strengthen his authority within the squad.

The 41-year-old manager himself addressed the issue, explaining that the perception of Moises Caicedo, Enzo Fernandez, and Palmer having egos is entirely incorrect.

Since taking the job, Rosenior has quietened doubts about whether he could handle a squad packed with high-priced talent. He has focused on building strong relationships, especially with players like Palmer and Fernandez.

There was a moment at Molineux when the No. 10 interrupted the manager‚Äôs post-match interview after scoring a hat-trick. It felt like more than just a bit of fun ‚Äì it was a sign that the dressing room is fully behind him.

Rosenior has also earned respect for his approach, often putting the focus on his players‚Äô effort rather than his own methods.

Even Fernandez, who had been linked to PSG before, appears re-energised under the Englishman. The midfielder has publicly acknowledged the head coach‚Äôs influence and thanked him for it.

Tributes poured in for the talented wideout who totaled 135 catches in three seasons that included 39 games. There were words from Louisville coach Jeff Brohm (who coached him at Purdue), Vikings head coach Kevin O'Connell, Cardinals social media and former teammates like J.J. Watt.

"I am devastated by the news of Rondale's death," wrote O'Connell. "While Rondale had been a member of the Vikings for a short time, he was someone we came to know well and care about deeply. title: M√≠chel demands consistency from the team before visiting Vitoria
description: In the preview of tomorrow's match in Vitoria, Girona FC coach M√≠chel S√°nchez conveyed a message of continuity and demand following last weekend's victory. The coach emphasized that despite the euph...
fullText:
In the preview of tomorrow's match in Vitoria, Girona FC coach M√≠chel S√°nchez conveyed a message of continuity and demand following last weekend's victory. The coach emphasized that despite the euphoria generated by the triumph against FC Barcelona, the team is now fully focused on the challenge of facing a Deportivo Alav√©s side characterized by their intensity at home. ‚ÄúIt has been a good week after winning a very special match. But we need to keep doing things well and pursuing the goal of forty-two points, which will likely ensure safety,‚Äù said M√≠chel, reminding that the focus remains on securing survival as soon as possible.

The coach warned of the difficulties of the match at Mendizorrotza and the need to deliver a very solid performance: ‚ÄúWe have to go to Vitoria with the mentality we have now. Alav√©s, at home, is very intense and performs very well. We have to play a great game to beat them. We must continue with this dynamic of play.‚Äù

M√≠chel insisted on the importance of maintaining the principles that have allowed the team to grow in recent matches: ‚ÄúWe must be able to maintain what we are doing well, we must be compact and fight for every ball.‚Äù

Regarding the team's good form, the coach highlighted that the improvement is the result of collective work: ‚ÄúWe have changed because we have done things better as a team. The result always shapes the mentality, but to have a good mentality, you have to work.‚Äù

Despite the euphoria following the victory against Bar√ßa, M√≠chel assures that the team is already fully refocused on tomorrow's match: ‚ÄúToday we had a very good training session. After the victory against Bar√ßa, there was logical euphoria, but now we have moved from that euphoria to having confidence and being focused on doing things well.‚Äù

The coach also highlighted the defensive progress of the red-and-white team: ‚ÄúWe have improved a lot in the defensive zone. The other day against Bar√ßa was the match where we conceded the fewest shots on goal in the entire league. That says a lot about our defensive improvement.‚Äù

Finally, he celebrated the internal competition within the squad: ‚ÄúIt is very good to have problems selecting the starting eleven because I have many players at my disposal and in good form,‚Äù and he concluded with a message of ambition and confidence: ‚ÄúIn any scenario, we can do things well.‚Äù

title: Everton v Manchester United: Key stats and talking points
description: A resurgent Manchester United have the chance to add to Everton's poor recent home form in the final fixture of the Premier League weekend on Monday at Hill Dickinson Stadium (20:00 GMT).  Having been eliminated from the FA Cup in the third round, both sides have had nearly a fortnight to reflect on their previous results in the top flight.  Everton were undone by eight minutes of chaos at home to Bournemouth to lose 2-1, while United salvaged a point at West Ham United in stoppage time.
fullText:
A resurgent Manchester United have the chance to add to Everton's poor recent home form in the final fixture of the Premier League weekend on Monday at Hill Dickinson Stadium (20:00 GMT).

Having been eliminated from the FA Cup in the third round, both sides have had nearly a fortnight to reflect on their previous results in the top flight.

Everton were undone by eight minutes of chaos at home to Bournemouth to lose 2-1, while United salvaged a point at West Ham United in stoppage time.

Everton are in a curious position at the moment. After numerous seasons of flirting with relegation, the table looks a lot rosier - they started the weekend in eighth position - yet there is still some frustration around recent performances at home.

The calamitous manner in which they threw away a winning position against Bournemouth left supporters angry, as a chance to consolidate a spot in the European positions was tossed away.

It's now six games without a win at Hill Dickinson Stadium in all competitions; they have lost five of their last nine Premier League home games, as many as they had in their previous 28.

That run is in stark contrast to the team's away form; they've won five, drawn four and lost one of their last nine.

Manager David Moyes will be hoping a visit from a big-name opponent can ignite the mood at the new 52,000-seat arena. The number of midweek games and Monday night matches have been a big factor in a number of low-key atmospheres at their new home.

United have 19 away wins and 42 wins overall against Everton in the Premier League, more than any team has against another team in the competition's history.

The Toffees did get the better of the Red Devils previously though, as they rallied from an early Idrissa Gueye red card to win 1-0 at Old Trafford thanks to a Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall goal. A win for Everton on Monday would give them just their second Premier League double over United, the first coming in 2013-14 when Moyes was in charge of the Red Devils.

That defeat in November was arguably the nadir for former boss Ruben Amorim. Plenty has changed since, with Michael Carrick in charge and the team playing with a renewed sense of freedom.

The draw at West Ham may have ended Carrick's winning start, but the team will take heart from the manner in which they fought to the end.

Benjamin Sesko's stoppage-time goal - his second in three games - was enough to extend the team's current unbeaten streak to nine. The improved form of the ¬£74m summer transfer will be a big relief at Old Trafford.

Overall, United have been the best team in the division in 2026, with no side able to better their haul of 15 Premier League points for the year; they have also scored more open play goals than any team since Carrick took charge.

Against a muddled opponent - their favourite opponent - they will be confident of adding to that on Merseyside.

title: Amadou Onana: Aston Villa react to one of their star players being linked with Man United
description: Between now and the summer, Manchester United will inevitably continue to be linked with some of the finest midfielders in the game.Indeed, it is football‚Äôs worst-kept secret that the 20-time Englis...
fullText:
Between now and the summer, Manchester United will inevitably continue to be linked with some of the finest midfielders in the game.

Indeed, it is football‚Äôs worst-kept secret that the 20-time English champions are desperate to strengthen their engine room.

With Casemiro set to leave, Manuel Ugarte failing to convince as his replacement, and the clear need for quality additions, United could therefore embark on a full midfield overhaul.

Only weeks after Everton‚Äôs Amadou Onana openly expressed his desire to join a world-class club, The Peoples Person recently covered a report suggesting that United were keen to reignite their interest in the Belgian midfielder.

Now, according to Football Insider, Aston Villa have responded to the Onana-to-United speculation.

The outlet claims: ‚ÄúAston Villa are determined to keep hold of Amadou Onana beyond the end of the season.‚Äù

Furthermore, the report adds: ‚ÄúUnai Emery views the 24-year-old as an important part of his first-team squad and hopes he will continue the positive progress he has made at Villa Park.‚Äù

Consequently, there is genuine hope at Villa Park that Onana will stay. The belief is that ‚Äúthere are other names on their list of targets which may give Villa confidence they can keep hold of him.‚Äù

Nevertheless, as Villa fight to retain their star man, it remains to be seen whether United will persist in their pursuit of Onana. After all, the Red Devils have admired him for a long time, having tried to sign him from Everton in 2024 before he opted to join Villa instead.

Since then, at Villa Park, Onana has blossomed into one of the Premier League‚Äôs finest central midfielders.

His rapid recovery pace, ability to break opposition lines, and ball-carrying strength have combined to make him a top-tier destroyer with genuine box-to-box qualities.

As a result, he is, without doubt, a player United could rely on as a brilliant Casemiro replacement, while at the same time offering a fresh dynamic in midfield.

Featured image Dan Mullan via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Official: Real Madrid confirm the injury of midfield star; player ruled out for seven weeks
description: Real Madrid‚Äôs problems have been compounded further as the club have been dealt yet another injury blow.Just a day after succumbing to a 2-1 loss at the hands of CA Osauna, the club have now confirm...
fullText:
Real Madrid‚Äôs problems have been compounded further as the club have been dealt yet another injury blow.

Just a day after succumbing to a 2-1 loss at the hands of CA Osauna, the club have now confirmed the injury of Dani Ceballos.

The Spanish midfielder had a horror night against Osasuna, making two notable errors, one of which led to Osasuna‚Äôs winning goal. The player later apologised to the fans for his mistakes, taking ownership of his actions.

In an official statement, Real Madrid have confirmed Ceballos has been diagnosed with a muscle tear in the soleus muscle in his right leg.

According to COPE, Ceballos‚Äô fresh injury could rule him out of action for at least seven weeks. This means he will miss most of the key matches that will define Real Madrid‚Äôs season.

Real Madrid will be ruled out for at least seven weeks due to injury. (Photo by Juan Manuel Serrano Arce/Getty Images)

Although the Spaniard wasn‚Äôt a key component in Alvaro Arbeloa‚Äôs plans, his injury will put pressure on the team by restricting the coach‚Äôs rotational options.

From a long-term perspective, this will mark the end of Ceballos‚Äô stint at Real Madrid, with recent reports suggesting that the club are more than keen on offloading the player in the summer.

Club president Florentino Perez is not happy with Ceballos at all and it appears Real Madrid are ready to sanction his sale for just ‚Ç¨10 million at the end of the season.

If there was a chance of a late revival, those chances disappeared after his poor showing against Osasuna. And now, with the injury, the Spaniard will no longer be able to prove himself at the Bernabeu.

title: Why Sidney Crosby isn't playing for Canada in gold medal game vs. USA with injury news
description: This is devastating news for Team Canada.
fullText:
Why Sidney Crosby isn't playing for Canada in gold medal game vs. USA with injury news originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

It's devastating news for Team Canada as the gold medal men's hockey game at the 2026 Winter Olympics has arrived on Sunday in Milan against Team USA.

Sidney Crosby, the Canadian captain and all-time great, has been ruled out. He's not playing. In what likely would've been his final Olympic game, Crosby can only watch.

It's a bummer for Canada, which advanced through the semifinal stage without Crosby.

Connor McDavid will again don the captain's 'C'.

Crosby was said to be a positive influence in the locker room between periods of the semifinal, and Canada will hope he can replicate that in the final.

MORE:¬†Eileen Gu responds to hate only way she knows how

Crosby is out due to a lower-body injury sustained in the Olympic quarterfinal.

In that game against Czechia, Crosby took three hits on one shift early in the second period. The second hit appeared to be the one that messed up something with Crosby's right knee or lower leg.

Crosby skated slowly off the ice, was checked out by trainers on the bench, then limped to the locker room.

The captain didn't return to that game, a comeback win in overtime for Canada. He then missed another comeback OT win for Team Canada on Friday over Finland, but the hope was he'd be back for the final game of the tournament.

Canada head coach Jon Cooper spoke Saturday about wanting to give Crosby every chance to play, but also that he and Crosby knew it wouldn't help the team if Crosby dressed but wasn't actually healthy.

He must not be healthy, because it's tough to believe Crosby would miss this stage unless it was absolutely necessary.

It gives Team Canada a rallying cry. They want to win this one for Sid.

title: Manchester United frontrunners to sign former Liverpool star
description: Since Arne Slot's arrival almost two years ago, Liverpool's squad has changed an awful lot. Indeed, most of the changes ended up occurring during the last summer transfer window but, right from the of...
fullText:
Since Arne Slot's arrival almost two years ago, Liverpool's squad has changed an awful lot.

Indeed, most of the changes ended up occurring during the last summer transfer window but, right from the off, it was clear that Slot's gameplan was completely different to Jurgen Klopp's.

In his first season, Liverpool's system stayed relatively similar but in the 2025-26 campaign, the Dutchman built his own team and the club have been struggling.

A lot of this is down to the many changes that the Reds made in such a short space of time but now, it seems like one of those players that Slot got rid of in the summer could be coming back to the Premier League.

Shop the goalkeeper range today

Shop the third kit range today!

Trent Alexander-Arnold's summer departure is arguably the one that hurt Liverpool fans the most.

The vast majority of the Reds' fanbase believed that the Englishman would see out the entirety of his career in L4 and eventually become the captain.

However, that wasn't mean to be and, in the end, he chose to join Real Madrid to experience football in another way.

Unfortunately, things haven't quite gone to plan with the Englishman often being left on the bench which has resulted in several transfer rumours emerging.

And now, as per an update from Fichajes, the most insane rumour of all has decided to crop up.

According to the Spanish outlet, Manchester United are the frontrunners to sign the Liverpool academy graduate.

The Red Devils are willing to pay around ¬£43 million to secure his services and see him as an 'interesting' market opportunity.

A fee in this region would be 'attractive' to Real Madrid with United looking to strengthen their defence next season.

Even though things ended badly between Liverpool and Alexander-Arnold, there's no way that the defender would ever join their arch-rivals.

Not only is the defender a Liverpool supporter himself but, if he did end up joining Michael Carrick's men, there would be no way back for him at Anfield, even if he begged the club to take him back.

Not only this, but last season, when the Reds won the Premier League, Manchester United failed to even qualify for any sort of European competition with the club finishing the campaign in 15th place.

This season, their position is slightly higher than Liverpool's but, without any sort of European football to worry about, their schedule is much less packed.

If Alexander-Arnold did join United, he'd be their first-choice right-back without question but, in our eyes, he'd be better off fighting for his place under Alvaro Arebola, especially after the Spaniard said he was happy to have Alexander-Arnold among his ranks.

title: What is Nick Suzuki's nationality? Team Canada forward, Canadiens' captain helped by strong parents
description: Suzuki has been key for Canada.
fullText:
What is Nick Suzuki's nationality? Team Canada forward, Canadiens' captain helped by strong parents originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Team Canada wouldn't even be in the Olympics gold medal game without Nick Suzuki.

In the quarterfinal against Czechia, it was Suzuki's late goal that forced overtime to allow Mitch Marner to win it in the extra period.

Suzuki grew up in a hockey family, and it allowed him to reach this point.

Here's a quick look at his background.

MORE:¬†Nathan MacKinnon went viral for his Olympic focus that paid off

Obviously, Suzuki is a native of Canada.

His father, Rob, is Japanese-Canadian.

His mother, Amanda, is actually British.

MORE:¬†Megan Keller's childhood dreams culminate in a dream come true

Suzuki's parents Rob and Amanda were certainly hockey parents.

They got to take all the journeys with Nick and his brother Ryan as they worked their way into long hockey careers.

Nick also battled health issues when he was small, including hand, foot and mouth disease; pneumonia due to respiratory synctial virus; and recurrent ear infections.

A story from NHL.com shared that saga, as well as the fact that Suzuki began skating at the age of 3 and that his health improved as he grew up.

Suzuki has certainly made the most of his journey.

title: Report ‚Äì PSG joins Arsenal in the race for La Liga attacker
description: Paris Saint-Germain has become the latest club to join Arsenal in the race for Julian Alvarez, amid growing indications that this could be his final season at Atletico Madrid. The Spanish side does no...
fullText:
Paris Saint-Germain has become the latest club to join Arsenal in the race for Julian Alvarez, amid growing indications that this could be his final season at Atletico Madrid. The Spanish side does not wish to part ways with the forward, however, his ongoing difficulties in adapting to their system may ultimately compel them to reconsider their position.

Arsenal, alongside several other clubs, continues to monitor his situation closely, with the Gunners convinced that he has already demonstrated his quality during his time in England. A potential move to the Emirates Stadium could prove attractive, particularly as Arsenal operates in a style similar to that of his former club, Manchester City.

Despite Arsenal‚Äôs sustained interest, Barcelona is understood to be Alvarez‚Äôs preferred destination. Nevertheless, the Catalan side may encounter financial constraints that could hinder their ability to meet the demands required to secure his transfer. This uncertainty leaves the door open for other suitors to intensify their pursuit.

The attacker is said to be determined to finish the current campaign strongly before making any final decision regarding his future. According to Sport Witness, Arsenal is now facing a significant challenge from Paris Saint-Germain in the race to secure his signature. The report claims that the French champions possess the financial capacity to pursue any leading player, which could present a considerable obstacle for the Gunners.

(Photo by Juan Manuel Serrano Arce/Getty Images)

While Atletico Madrid would prefer to retain Alvarez, the tactical mismatch may leave them with limited options should interest continue to grow. Both Arsenal and Paris Saint-Germain are expected to deploy their most persuasive strategies once the season concludes, as they seek to convince him to commit to their respective sporting projects.

With financial strength, tactical suitability, and long-term ambition all likely to influence the final outcome, the coming months are set to be decisive in determining where Alvarez will continue his career.
